full_text: The DOD has awarded Lockheed Martin a $19.3 million Prototype Project Agreement to create a 5G communications network infrastructure testbed for expeditionary operations experimentation for the Office of the Under Secretary of Defense for Research and Engineering (OUSD R&E) and the U.S. Marine Corps.

title: Orca Systems Announces First Fully Integrated SoC Solution for Direct-to-Satellite IoT Connectivity
full_text: Orca Systems announced its first wireless SoC solution for the satellite IoT, the ORC3990, enabling RF technology for indoor operation over Totum’s LEO network.

title: UK and Japan to Work Together on Leading Fighter Jet Sensor
full_text: With joint work on the project scheduled to start in April, JAGUAR is expected to create 75 jobs across the U.K., including 40 highly-skilled engineering jobs at Leonardo’s Edinburgh site.

title: 3D-Printed Antennas Ushering in New Capabilities for NRAO
full_text: A series of trials pitting Optisys' capabilities against other traditionally and non-traditionally produced antennas identified Optisys as the winner in SWaP, performance, stability and other areas and led to a new partnership between Optisys and NRAO.

title: ERZIA Receives Multi-year Order From Indra for Integrated Microwave Assemblies
full_text: ERZIA is set to deliver several integrated microwave assemblies to Indra, designed for electronic warfare purpose, under a multi-year contract between both companies.

title: U.S. Air Force Procures Orolia’s CRPA Testing Solution
full_text: Orolia Defense & Security was selected by the U.S. Air Force Guided Weapons Evaluation Facility to deliver a BroadSim Wavefront.

title: Epirus Unveils Portable HPM Leonidas™ Pod
full_text: Epirus announced the introduction of Leonidas Pod, a first-to-market, solid-state, multiple shot high-power microwave (HPM) system and the latest addition to the company’s suite of advanced electronic warfare solutions.

title: OneWeb Confirms Successful Launch of 34 Satellites, Delivering Ongoing Momentum at the Start of 2022
full_text: OneWeb confirmed the successful deployment of 34 satellites by Arianespace from the Guiana Space Center in Kourou, French Guiana.

title: Frequency Matters, Feb 11: Satellite/Radio issue, News/Events
full_text: Pat Hindle, Microwave Journal Media Director, and guest co-host Yasmine King, GM of Aerospace & Defense at ADI, discuss the Feb Satellite and Radio Communications themed issue articles, LEO and hypersonic missile news and market trends, 5G news, and upcoming events.

title: Natilus Announces $6B in Advance Purchase Commitments to Deliver Autonomous Cargo Aircraft
full_text: Natilus announced advanced purchase commitments of more than $6 billion for the delivery of 440+ aircraft in pre-orders, from companies including major airlines and integrators.

title: Curtiss-Wright Collaborates with Northrop Grumman to Migrate Legacy Avionics Software to Modern Hardware
full_text: Curtiss-Wright’s Defense Solutions announced that it is collaborating with Northrop Grumman to bring real-time virtualization and modernized protection (ReVAMP) technology to the embedded avionics market.

title: Kratos Receives $50M Contract Value Increase for C5ISR Program System Hardware Platform
full_text: Kratos Defense & Security Solutions, Inc. announced that it has received an approximately $50 million contract value increase for an existing C5ISR Program, providing specialized products, hardware, engineering and other services and deliverables.

title: Hensoldt Supports Next-Generation European Data Link
full_text: HENSOLDT brings its experience in the area of Tactical Data Links, IFF and sensor fusion develop an independent next-generation Tactical Data Link through a European project called European Secure Software-defined Radio Multifunctional Information Distribution System (ESSOR MIDS).

title: Cobham SATCOM Joins the Digital IF Interoperability Consortium
full_text: Cobham SATCOM and the Digital IF Interoperability Consortium (DIFI) announced Cobham’s membership in the DIFI Consortium.

title: Safran Supplies SPARTE 700 Telemetry Antenna to the U.S. Air Force
full_text: Safran Data Systems Inc. has received an award for the supply of two 7.3M Tracking Telemetry Antennas to be installed at Eglin Air Force Base, a U.S. Air Force Major Range and Test Facility Base in Florida.

title: Rohde & Schwarz Announces Virtual Satellite Industry Days for 2022
full_text: Rohde & Schwarz has announced a programme of Satellite Industry Days, offering a series of online and hybrid events to discuss the latest developments and applications in satellite and space technology.

title: Anritsu Introduces Rack Mount Remote Spectrum Monitors  with Frequencies Up To 43.5 GHz
full_text: Anritsu Company introduces the MS27201A Remote Spectrum Monitor series that includes the industry’s first remote spectrum monitor that covers 43.5 GHz to support new satellite downlink bands. Combining high RF performance with supporting PC software, the MS27201A series delivers a unique package for long-term monitoring in a variety of commercial and regulatory environments.

title: IARPA Selects BAE Systems to Advance Machine Learning to Assure Data Security
full_text: BAE Systems has been awarded a $14 million contract from IARPA to develop tools to decipher an ever-growing number of RF signals in order to quickly and accurately help secure mission-critical information.

title: Groundbreaking Satellite Technology Following Breakthrough Antenna Trials with Isotropic Systems
full_text: Isotropic Systems announced the successful completion of advanced multi-orbit antenna trials which will enable a new age of resilience for worldwide government communications increasingly reliant on satellite connectivity on the ground, at sea and in the air.

title: Kratos and Kymeta Collab on Advanced Antenna Technologies Integration with Software-Defined Ground Systems
full_text: Kymeta and Kratos Defense & Security Solutions, Inc announced a strategic partnership to jointly develop products and solutions that will enable modern, virtualized ground systems to better leverage the capabilities of next-generation mobile satellite antennas.

title: Pixus Announces New MIL Rugged Rackmount SOSA™  Aligned Chassis With Advanced Cooling
full_text: Pixus Technologies has a new 6U tall 19” rackmount chassis for 3U OpenVPX and SOSA aligned boards designed specifically for the high-power requirements of solutions that are aligned to the SOSA technical standard.

title: CAES Collaborates with Lattice Semiconductor to Provide Radiation-Tolerant FPGAs
full_text: CAES and Lattice Semiconductor Corporation announced an agreement whereby CAES will qualify and sell radiation-tolerant Lattice FPGAs for space and satellite applications.

title: Collins Aerospace Granted Developmental Licenses for Iridium Certus Satcom Solutions
full_text: Iridium recently awarded Collins Aerospace an Iridium Certus Developmental Over-the-Air License for Collins’ new active low gain antenna and a high gain antenna.

title: USMC Awards L3Harris $750M IDIQ Contract for Multi-Channel Radios
full_text: The U.S. Marine Corps has awarded L3Harris Technologies a competitive 10-year, $750 million single-award IDIQ contract for multi-channel handheld and vehicular radio systems.

title: Mercury Systems Awarded $17M Contract for Ruggedized RF Microelectronics
full_text: Mercury Systems, Inc. announced it was awarded a $17 million contract to provide crucial RF microelectronics supporting missile capabilities of the U.S. and its allies in ensuring 21st century air dominance.

title: Mercury Introduces the RFM3202: the Most Bandwidth in a 3U Microwave Transceiver
full_text: The RFM3202 high spectral density 3U OpenVPX™ microwave transceiver supports ultra-wide, ultra-high-bandwidth applications from 0.3 GHz up to 18 GHz.

title: Navy Unveils Next-Generation DDG(X) Warship Concept with Hypersonic Missiles, Lasers
full_text: The U.S. Navy wants its next warship to fire hypersonic missiles and lasers that would be 10x more powerful than the service’s existing laser weapons, according to the most detailed outlook to date of the DDG(X) next-generation warship issued by the service.

title: Egypt - Air Defense Radar Systems
full_text: The State Department has made a determination approving a possible foreign military sale to the Government of Egypt of Air Defense Radar Systems and related equipment for an estimated cost of $355 million.

title: Lockheed Martin Moves Head with Placing Hypersonic Missiles Aboard Navy Zumwalt-Class Land-Attack Destroyers
full_text: U.S. Navy surface warship experts are asking engineers at Lockheed Martin Corp. to start integrating future hypersonic missiles aboard the Navy's three stealthy Zumwalt-class (DDG 1000) destroyers.

title: Hughes and Network Services Solutions to Deploy Enhanced Pipeline Monitoring Network
full_text: Hughes Network Systems, LLC and Network Services Solutions (NSS) announced an eight-year agreement to upgrade, expand and manage the satellite monitoring network for a large petroleum customer of NSS.

title: 3U VPX FPGA Modules First to Market with High Bandwidth Memory
full_text: Mercury Systems, Inc. announced the Model 5585 and Model 5586 SOSA aligned Xilinx Virtex UltraScale+™ high bandwidth memory (HBM) FPGA 3U VPX modules.

title: OneWeb and Hughes Announce Agreement to Bring LEO Satellite Broadband Service to India
full_text: OneWeb and Hughes Network Systems LLC announced a strategic six-year distribution partner agreement to provide low Earth orbit (LEO) connectivity services across India.

title: BAE Systems Awarded a $60 Million Contract to Expand Domestic Supply of State-of-the-Art Microelectronics Technology
full_text: BAE Systems has been awarded a $60 million contract from the Army Contracting Command – Rock Island under the Cornerstone Other Transaction Authority to develop certain types of next-generation, RHBD microelectronics, leveraging Intel Foundry Services.

title: Eclipse Global Connectivity, Smiths Interconnect and ST Engineering iDirect Collaborate to Deliver Airborne ISR Satcom Capability
full_text: Eclipse Global Connectivity, Smiths Interconnect and ST Engineering iDirect announced their collaboration to deliver an integrated airborne intelligence surveillance and reconnaissance (A-ISR) satellite communications capability for military and government aircraft.

title: New Open Architecture Transceiver Brings Advanced EW Performance to Smaller Platforms
full_text: Mercury Systems, Inc. announced the new RFM3202 SOSA aligned wideband transceiver for demanding spectrum processing applications, achieving what previously required multiple products, enabling much-needed capabilities for smaller platforms.

title: Mitsubishi Electric Develops Smallest Antenna Prototype for High-precision Satellite-based Positioning in 4 Bands
full_text: Mitsubishi Electric Corporation announced that it has developed a prototype of the world's smallest antenna for high-precision satellite-based positioning in four frequency bands used by the world's main satellite-positioning systems and positioning-augmentation services.

title: €260M Contracts Will See Leonardo Play Core Role in E-scan Radar for German and Spanish Typhoons
full_text: Leonardo announced that it has signed over €260M of contracts with HENSOLDT which will see the company playing a key role in the development and delivery of the Eurofighter Typhoon’s ECRS Mk1 E-scan radar, ordered by Germany and Spain.

title: Verus® Research Announces First Missile Defense Agency Contract for R&D of Missile Defense Applications
full_text: Verus® Research announced it has been awarded a Phase I Small Business Innovative Research contract from the Missile Defense Agency (MDA) for “Optimized Waveforms for X-Band Missile-Defense Radars.”

title: Thales Alenia Space to Build State-of-the-Art Intelsat 41 and Intelsat 44
full_text: Thales Alenia Space announced that it has signed a contract with Intelsat to deliver two Space Inspire software-defined satellites, Intelsat 41 (IS-41) and Intelsat 44 (IS-44).

title: CesiumAstro Releases S-Band Inter-Satellite Link With Software-Defined Capability
full_text: CesiumAstro, Inc. announced the release of the S-Band CommPack Inter-Satellite Link (ISL) for commercial, government and defense applications, built to NASA GEVS standards and available in volume.

title: Isotropic Systems Appoints Rash Sahota as General Manager & Chief Operating Officer
full_text: Isotropic Systems announced that Rash Sahota has been appointed as general manager and chief operating officer. Sahota will be responsible for ensuring the company delivers its vision and strategy, while managing costs and driving revenue growth.

title: Gowanda Electronics Signs Global Distribution Agreement with TTI
full_text: Gowanda Electronics announced it has signed a global distribution agreement with TTI, Inc. in which TTI’s sales operations in the Americas, Europe, Middle East, Africa and Asia covers products manufactured by Gowanda and several sister brands in the iNRCORE family.

title: Leonardo Completes the Acquisition of 25.1% in Hensoldt
full_text: Leonardo completed the acquisition from Square Lux Holding II S.à r.l. of 25.1 percent of the shares in HENSOLDT AG for a cash consideration of €606 million.

title: DARPA Awards Epirus Contract to Accelerate Advancement of EM and RF Capabilities
full_text: Epirus, Inc. has been selected for DARPA’s WARDEN RANGER project along with the Georgia Tech Research Corporation on up to three project phases to deliver software for rapid computation of electromagnetic propagation effects.

title: OneWeb Confirms Successful Launch of 36 Satellites, After Rapid Year of Progress
full_text: OneWeb confirmed its successful deployment of 36 satellites by Arianespace from the Baikonur Cosmodrome. This latest launch brings OneWeb’s total in-orbit constellation to 394 satellites.

title: NGC and Raytheon Technologies Team Complete NGI SRR
full_text: The Northrop Grumman Corporation and Raytheon Technologies Next Generation Interceptor (NGI) team has completed its System Requirements Review and is proceeding with initial system design, further risk reduction testing and critical component qualification activities.

title: Advancing F-35 Electronic Warfare Capabilities
full_text: BAE Systems received a $493M contract to significantly upgrade and modernize the EW system for the F-35 Lightning II, enabling the fighter to quickly detect and address evolving electromagnetic threats.

title: Teledyne e2v HiRel Releases Catalog Radiation Tolerant X-Band LNA for Space Applications
full_text: Teledyne e2v HiRel announced the availability of a rad-tolerant X-Band low noise amplifier (LNA), model TDLNA001013, that is ideal for use in demanding high reliability, space and defense applications.

title: Teledyne e2v HiRel Releases Catalog Radiation Tolerant 20 GHz SPDT Absorptive RF Switch
full_text: Teledyne e2v HiRel announced the availability of a rad-tolerant 20 GHz, single pole double throw (SPDT) absorptive RF switch, model TDSW020A2T, that is ideal for use in demanding high reliability, space and defense applications.

title: 2021 AOC Returns to the Crows Nest in Washington
full_text: After a year barrage jammed by COVID-19, the Association of Old Crows (AOC) International Symposium & Convention returned to its crows’ nest in Washington, D.C., running from 30 November through 2 December.

title: Not Your Parents’ 5G: New Use Cases for Military and Government
full_text: Isola Group, a global innovator in materials for printed-circuit boards (PCBs), has announced its low-loss I-Tera® MT40 circuit materials supporting multilayer printed circuit boards (PCBs) for military- and commercial-grade low-Earth-orbit (LEO) satellites.

title: Defense Market Trends and the Impact on Semiconductor Technology
full_text: The Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) has executed a $316 million contract option for BAE Systems’ advanced M-Code GPS modules, raising the contract funding to $641 million.

title: Isola Materials Support Military LEO Satellites
full_text: Microwave Journal Editorial Director and guest co-host Yasmine King, GM of A&D at Analog Devices, cover the Dec Gov't and Military Electronics issue technical articles, latest A&D news featuring an update on hypersonic threats and EuMW Defense Forum.

title: $316M Contract to Deliver Hardened Military GPS Modules
full_text: The Air Force Metrology and Calibration Authority (AFMETCAL) has ordered signal source analyzers from Rohde & Schwarz to be operated in AFMETCAL’s precision measurement equipment laboratories and the Air Force primary standards laboratory.

title: Frequency Matters, Dec 3: Gov't & Military Electronics Issue, News and Events
full_text: CAES has released the industry’s smallest 0.5 to 18 GHz single-3U-slot wideband up/down converter with integrated local oscillator and preselection.

title: SSA from Rohde & Schwarz in Operation at Laboratories of US Air Force
full_text: Verus® Research announced it has been awarded a $450,000 one-year task with the U.S. Army to enhance Directed Energy System Placement Analysis (DESPA) capability for test and evaluation purposes.

title: CAES Introduces Rapid Tuning, Wide Bandwidth Up/Down Converter in a Compact Single 3U Slice
full_text: N/A

title: Verus® Research Awarded U.S. Army Contract for  Directed Energy System Placement Analysis Capability
full_text: N/A

title: BAE New FireNet Transceiver Completes Successful Capability Demo for Rotary Wing Aircraft
full_text: BAE Systems successfully completed a capability demonstration of its FireNet™ software-defined communication transceiver, successfully displaying the FireNet system’s additional channel capabilities for rotary wing aircraft.

title: NGC to Increase Inventory of AARGM for the US Navy and German AF
full_text: Northrop Grumman Corporation received a $153 million dollar contract award from the U.S. Navy for full rate production of lots 10 and 11 of the AGM-88E2 Advanced Anti-Radiation Guided Missile (AARGM).

title: Kymeta and OneWeb Partner to Develop Flat Panel User Terminal for LEO Network
full_text: Kymeta and OneWeb announced a joint development agreement (JDA) to develop an innovative flat panel electronically steered user terminal that is compatible with the OneWeb network to support land fixed applications and leading the way to various mobility applications.

title: Mercury Systems Announces High Speed 3U VPX Synchronizer Module for Phase-Coherent Signal Acquisition
full_text: Mercury Systems, Inc. announced the Model 5503 Sensor Open Systems Architecture™ (SOSA) aligned high speed 3U VPX synchronizer module (a SOSA plug-in-card).

title: SWISSto12’s Micro-Geostationary Satellite Wins ESA Support
full_text: The small telecommunications satellite developed by SWISSto12 SA, intended for launch into geostationary orbit some 36,000 km above the earth—which can be used as a basis for future satellites—has won support from ESA.

title: Mercury Systems Acquires Atlanta Micro
full_text: Under the terms of the purchase agreement, Mercury acquired Atlanta Micro for all cash, subject to net working capital and net debt adjustments.

title: NASA, SpaceX Launch DART: First Test Mission to Defend Planet Earth
full_text: NASA’s Double Asteroid Redirection Test (DART), the world’s first full-scale mission to test technology for defending earth against potential asteroid or comet hazards, launched Wednesday, November 24 at 1:21 a.m. EST on a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket.

title: MDA Selects Raytheon Missiles & Defense to Develop First-Ever Counter-Hypersonic Interceptor
full_text: Raytheon Missiles & Defense has been selected by the Missile Defense Agency (MDA) as one of the companies to develop and test the Glide Phase Interceptor (GPI), will defeat a new generation of hypersonic missiles—weapons that travel more than 5x the speed of sound and maneuver rapidly in flight.

title: Thales Alenia Space to Build State-of-the-Art ASTRA 1P and ASTRA 1Q Satellites for SES
full_text: Thales Alenia Space, a joint venture between Thales and Leonardo, announced that it has signed a contract with SES to deliver two Ku-Band GEO satellites, ASTRA 1P and ASTRA 1Q.

title: NGC Platform-Agnostic AN/ASQ-236 Dragon's Eye Pod Achieves 1st Flight on an Operational F-16
full_text: The Air National Guard has flown the Northrop Grumman Corporation 236 Dragon’s Eye active electronically scanned array (AESA) radar pod on an operational F-16 for the first time.

title: CPI TMD Technologies Division Secures Another Important Defense Contract
full_text: The TMD Technologies Division of Communications & Power Industries has now successfully negotiated a key contract for the supply of a derivative of its well-proven microwave power modules.

title: Thales and Diehl Join Airbus to Develop Flight Control Computers for CityAirbus NextGen
full_text: The central flight control system of CityAirbus NextGen, the electric vertical take-off and landing vehicle (eVTOL) being developed by Airbus, will combine extraordinary computing power with lightweight design and highest safety standards.

title: DARPA Selects BAE Systems to Advance Quantum Technology for Military Antennas
full_text: BAE Systems has been awarded multiple development contracts from the DARPA to advance quantum technology and revolutionize RF sensing by breaking constraints to antenna designs that have persisted for more than a century.

title: Zephyr HAPS Achieves Connectivity in Trial Conducted by Airbus and NTT DOCOMO
full_text: Airbus and NTT DOCOMO, INC. have demonstrated the ability to use its solar-powered Zephyr High Altitude Platform Station (HAPS) to deliver future wireless broadband connectivity.

title: L3Harris to Upgrade Space Force Counter-Communications Via $125M Contract
full_text: L3Harris Technologies received a $125 million multi-year contract to produce space electronic warfare systems that safeguard U.S. military operations and warfighters.

title: Ground Master 400 Alpha, Taking Long-Range Air Surveillance to the Next Level
full_text: Thales launched the latest member of the Ground Master family radar portfolio, the GM400 Alpha, an unprecedented 3D long-range air surveillance radar with 5x more processing power.

title: Renesas Expands Satcom Portfolio with Industry’s First Commercial Dual-Beam Active Beamforming IC Lineup
full_text: Renesas Electronics Corporation expanded its portfolio of mmWave LNAs and Tx BFICs with the introduction of three new dual-beam active beamforming ICs.

title: Rohde & Schwarz and OpenWorks Prove New Counter UAS Technology at NATO TIE Exercise
full_text: Rohde & Schwarz and OpenWorks successfully prove a new high performance and autonomous 3D detection and tracking system for use in counter UAS missions, as part of NATO Technical Interoperability Exercise.

title: Thales and Indra Join to Develop Tactical Radio for Provide Spanish and French Armed Forces
full_text: Thales and Indra have agreed to start the joint development of the SYNAPS Multipurpose tactical radio with the aim of providing the Spanish and French Armed Forces with a common and versatile state-of-the-art solution.

title: Lockheed Martin and Keysight Test 5G Solutions for Aerospace and Defense Communications
full_text: Lockheed Martin and Keysight Technologies, Inc. announced a collaboration to advance 5G in support of mission-critical communications for aerospace and defense applications.

title: Babcock, Elbit UK and QinetiQ Awarded Contract for the UK Royal Navy's Maritime EW Systems Integrated Capability
full_text: Babcock International Group has been awarded a c.£100m, 13-year contract by the U.K.’s Defence Equipment and Support for the design, manufacture, delivery/commissioning and in-service support to the Maritime Electronic Warfare Systems Integrated Capability Increment 1.

title: TÜV SÜD Launches UK’s First Complete RADAR Test Service
full_text: TÜV SÜD launched its dedicated Maritime SOLAS Radar Test Range, the only independent test house in the U.K. and one of three in the world, to offer ISO 17025 accredited testing against IEC 62388.

title: Blue Danube Systems Enables First Broadband Access with Phased Arrays from the Stratosphere on HAPS
full_text: Blue Danube’s BeamCraft™ 500 was launched and operated on an unmanned stratospheric platform as part of a project in New Mexico led by Sceye.

title: CSUG & Teledyne e2v Unveil AI-Enabled Smart Nanosatellite with On-Board Imaging Processing at Space Tech Expo 2021
full_text: The Centre Spatial Universitaire de Grenoble, in partnership with Teledyne e2v, will be using this year’s Space Tech Expo to provide visitors with a detailed demonstration of a high performance image analysis system for CubeSat deployment.

title: Kymeta, Intelsat and Fraunhofer IIS Successfully Demonstrate Satellite-Enabled 5G Connectivity
full_text: Kymeta and Intelsat announced the successful demonstration of satellite-enabled 5G services on Kymeta’s electronically steered flat-panel u8 antenna using Intelsat’s global integrated satellite and terrestrial network—the first test of its kind in a mobile environment.

title: Viasat and Inmarsat to Combine, Creating a New Leading Global Communications Innovator
full_text: Viasat Inc. announced they have entered into a definitive agreement under which Viasat will acquire Inmarsat in a transaction valued at $7.3 billion, comprised of $850.0 million in cash, approximately 46.36 million shares of Viasat common stock valued at $3.1 billion based on the closing price and the assumption of $3.4 billion of net debt.

title: Mercury Systems Completes Acquisition of Avalex Technologies
full_text: Mercury acquired Avalex for all cash, subject to net working capital and net debt adjustments.

title: LM and Verizon to Advance 5G Innovation for US DoD
full_text: Verizon and Lockheed Martin have signed an agreement to collaborate on 5G.MIL™ technologies that will provide ultra-secure, reliable connections for U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) systems.

title: Qorvo® Announces Appointment of Philip Chesley as President of Infrastructure & Defense Products
full_text: Qorvo® announced the appointment of Philip Chesley as president of Qorvo’s Infrastructure & Defense Products segment, effective November 1, 2021.

title: Sofant Technologies Signs €7.3M Contract with European Space Agency
full_text: Scottish radio technology company Sofant Technologies has received significant financial backing (€7.3M) from the UK Space Agency  and the European Space Agency to support the commercialisation of its low-cost low-power satellite communications platform.

title: Isotropic Systems Redefines Global Satellite Services with First-Ever Multi-Orbit Field Tests
full_text: Isotropic Systems and SES announced the successful completion of the first-ever simultaneous multi-orbit antenna field tests, a game-changing development empowering a new age of connectivity on land, in the air and at sea for both civil and defense communications.

title: CPI TMD Technologies Exhibits Latest Microwave Power Module and More, at Booth 723 at AOC 2021
full_text: The TMD Technologies Division of Communications & Power Industries (CPI) will showcase a selection of its latest products for defense and homeland security systems at the upcoming 58th Annual AOC International Symposium and Convention.

title: Liberty Defense Attracts Prominent Industry Talent to Advance its Threat Detection Technology
full_text: Liberty Defense Holdings Ltd. announced that it has attracted two recognized industry leaders to its team: Ajay Subramanian and Jeffrey S. Gordon.

title: Mercury Systems Announces SOSA Aligned Development Platform to Simplify Complex Subsystem Design
full_text: Mercury Systems, Inc. announced the Model 8257A Development Platform aligned to the Sensor Open Systems Architecture™ Technical Standard.

title: NGC Establishes New Microelectronics Packaging Facility for Next-Gen Defense Applications
full_text:
Northrop Grumman's new “Micro-Line” μ-Line establishes a semiconductor 
post-processing and test source tailored for defense applications.

title: Blue Origin and Sierra Space Developing Commercial Space Station
full_text: Blue Origin and Sierra Space announced plans for Orbital Reef, a commercially developed, owned and operated space station to be built in low earth orbit.

title: General Dynamics Land Systems & Epirus Sign Strategic Teaming Agreement
full_text: GD and Epirus will collaborate to integrate the Leonidas directed energy system and broader high-power microwave technology into the U.S. Army’s Stryker and other manned and autonomous ground combat vehicles.

title: Orolia Signs an Agreement to Acquire Seven Solutions
full_text: Orolia is acquiring Seven Solutions, which will enhance Orolia’s portfolio for defense, aerospace, data centers, telecom, financial services, smart grids and other critical infrastructure industries.

title: U.S. Air Force Names Leonardo DRS for Range IDIQ Support Effort Contract
full_text: Leonardo DRS announced that it has been awarded a position on a U.S. Air Force contract to build range electronic warfare threat systems for combat training.

title: Thales Receives First Order for Javelin Radios in Support of U.S. Army's Single Channel Radio Program
full_text: Thales has been awarded its first delivery order from the U.S. Army to provide the AN/PRC-170 Javelin Radio.

title: Smiths Interconnect Launches K-Band Passive Components for Space Applications
full_text: Smiths Interconnect launches its broad range of K-Band passive components for satellite communication payloads in GEO/MEO and LEO orbits.

title: Curtiss-Wright Defense Introduces New Starter Kit System and 8-Slot OpenVPX™ Chassis
full_text: Curtiss-Wright’s new VPX3-E320 Ruggedized Universal SDR module, developed under agreement with NI, is the first fully rugged OpenVPX variant of the popular Ettus Research USRP E320 SDR solution.

title: OneWeb Confirms Successful Launch of 36 Satellites from Vostochny
full_text: OneWeb confirmed its successful launch of 36 satellites by Arianespace from the Vostochny Cosmodrome.

title: Northrop Grumman Connects Warfighters to the Future
full_text: During a flight test of the U.S. Army’s Integrated Air and Missile Defense Battle Command System, developed by Northrop Grumman, data from Army, Air Force and Marine Corps sensors and weapons systems were fused on a network.

title: Elbit Adds Multi-Channel and Full-Duplex Capabilities to E-LynX Family of SDRs
full_text: Elbit Systems added multi-channel and full-duplex technologies to its E-LynX™ family of software-defined radios.

title: Fast Forward: US Army Accelerates Delivery of Sentinel A4 Missile Defense Radar
full_text: The U.S. Army Sentinel A4 Program Office provided an accelerated contract award to Lockheed Martin to begin production for five additional radar systems developed specifically to detect and identify cruise missiles, unmanned aerial systems, rotary wing and fixed wing aircraft and rocket, artillery and mortar threats.

title: US Army Orders 1,000 New L3Harris Falcon IV Compact Team Radios to Enhance Tactical Communications
full_text: The U.S. Army has ordered 1,000 new L3Harris Technologies Falcon® IV AN/PRC-171 Compact Team Radios to ensure soldiers at any tactical level can transmit crucial information to command teams across an integrated network.

title: ERZIA to Exhibit at AOC Europe in Booth B14
full_text: ERZIA Technologies announced that they will be exhibiting in person in booth B14 at the upcoming Association of Old Crows (AOC) Europe Conference and Exhibition in Liverpool, U.K., October 12-13, 2021.

title: LM Delivers Long Range Hypersonic Weapon's Ground System to US Army
full_text: Lockheed Martin celebrated with the U.S. Army the delivery of critical ground equipment for its LRHW system—part of a rapid, multi-year hypersonic weapons development program supporting the service’s focus on long-range precision fires.

title: Hensoldt Develops Multifunctional Jammer to Counter New Threats
full_text: HENSOLDT has developed a multi-function jamming system called 'Kalaetron Attack' that can actively jam enemy radars in an extremely wide frequency band, but can also be used passively as a reconnaissance sensor.

title: Thales Unveils the Ground Observer 20 Multi-Mission Radar
full_text: The Thales GO 20 MM radar uniquely combines ground and low-level air surveillance in a single surveillance asset, the radar offers exceptional early UAV detection and automatic classification.

title: Antares Defence Systems Acquires Scimitar Technology Ltd
full_text: Antares Defence Systems announced the acquisition of Scimitar Technology Ltd.

title: NGC's AARGM-ER Transitions into LRIP
full_text: The U.S. Navy has awarded Northrop Grumman Corporation the contract to proceed with low rate initial production (LRIP) for the AGM-88G Advanced Anti-Radiation Guided Missile Extended Range.

title: TMD USA Wins Major Defense Contract
full_text: TMD Technologies, LLC has won a large defense contract for travelling wave tube amplifiers (TWTAs) for use in a radar unmanned aerial vehicle program.

title: The Last Drone Standing: First Responder UAS Endurance Challenge
full_text: The First Responder Unmanned Aircraft System (UAS) Endurance Challenge addressed the obstacle of extending the flight time for drones that carry heavy payloads.  Forty-three teams entered the competition, of which five final competitors spent a total of 14 months designing and building lightweight drones.

title: OneWeb and SatixFy Sign Agreement for IFC Compact Terminal
full_text: OneWeb and SatixFy UK have signed an agreement to develop a new In-Flight Connectivity (IFC) terminal that will work over the OneWeb network as well as on GEO satellite networks.

title: Thales Launches its New Digital Secondary Radar RSM NG
full_text: Thales unveils the RSM NG, an innovative meta-sensor for safer skies that leverages the latest digital technologies to bring airports outstanding performances, cyber protection and optimised life-cycle costs.

title: Nano Dimension’s First AME Monolithic RF Communications Circuit Was Sent to ISS Flight Studies
full_text: Nano Dimension Ltd. announced that the first ever integrated RF circuit fabricated by Nano Dimension and designed and integrated by L3Harris, has been flown to the International Space Station.

title: Laird R&F Products Develops Lightweight and Corrosion-Resistant Microwave Absorbers
full_text: Laird R&F Products has developed a series of lightweight and corrosion-resistant microwave absorbers that perform reliably at low frequencies and amid harsh environmental conditions.

title: New ThinKom Antenna Design Offers Flexible Installation Options for Special-Purpose Aircraft
full_text: ThinKom Solutions, Inc. has developed a new product variant of its VICTS aero satellite communication antennas enabling more flexible installation choices and allowing for smaller distributed and embedded phased array applications.

title: CAES Receives Hypersonic Antenna Development Contract
full_text: CAES has received a contract from the U.S. government to develop advanced antenna technology for hypersonic applications.

title: Keysight and Aview Join Forces to Build a mmWave Radar Laboratory
full_text: Keysight Technologies, Inc. has announced that Keysight and Aview have joined forces to establish a mmWave radar laboratory to be located in Suzhou, China designed to help promote the development of autonomous driving technologies.

title: Lepton Global Solutions Announces Partnership with Satcube to Expand Network Offering for Portable VSATs
full_text: A new partnership between Satcube and Lepton Global Solutions will add Satcube’s class of extremely small VSAT terminals to the company’s global satellite network, which is engineered to support terminal aperture sizes down to 45 cm. In turn, Lepton Global Solutions will offer Satcube Ku terminals globally as a comms-on-the-pause solution that are complementary with the Kymeta™ u8 comms-on-the-move offering.

title: Qorvo Technology Enables Perseverance Rover’s Safe Descent to Mars
full_text: Qorvo® was an integral part of the Mars Perseverance 2020 Mission that successfully landed an unmanned rover on Mars on February 18, 2021.

title: Thales Alenia Space Will Play a Major Role On-board Galileo Second Generation
full_text: Thales Alenia Space, a joint venture between Thales and Leonardo  has signed a 772M EUR contract with the European Space Agency (ESA) to provide six satellites part of the Second Generation of Galileo constellation.

title: Elbit Awarded a $300M Contract to Supply Hermes 900 Unmanned Aircraft Systems to a Country in Asia
full_text: Elbit Systems Ltd. announced that it was awarded an approximately $300 million contract by a country in Asia to provide Hermes 900 Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS). The contract will be performed over a period of five years.

title: Teledyne e2v HiRel and Integra Technologies Partner on High Voltage GaN
full_text: Teledyne e2v HiRel Electronics announced a new high reliability partnership with California-based Integra Technologies, Inc. Under the new agreement, Teledyne will leverage Integra’s portfolio of GaN on SiC RF power transistor products to deliver optimized power solutions for the space market.

title: BAE Systems Starts Electronic Warfare System Production for U.S. Air Force F-15s
full_text: BAE Systems has received a $58 million contract from Boeing to start Low Rate Initial Production (LRIP) of the F-15 Eagle Passive Active Warning and Survivability System (EPAWSS) for the U.S. Air Force.

title: Smiths Interconnect’s Contact Technology Launched on NASA Mars Perseverance Rover

title: Smiths Interconnect Flies High on F-35 Aircraft
full_text: Smiths Interconnect has been involved in the F-35 Lightning II programme for over 20 years, supplying hundreds of different interconnect devices including high reliability technologies, from RF components and high speed/power/density/filtered connectors to integrated microwave assemblies.

title: Leonardo Contributes to the Innovation of the Sardinia Radio Telescope in Sardinia

full_text: Pentek, Inc. announced the newest member of its highly popular Jade® family of high performance XMC FPGA modules. The Jade Model 71891 XMC module is an L-Band RF tuner with two 400 MHz A/Ds based on the high density Xilinx Kintex UltraScale FPGA.

title: Qorvo Introduces New Compact I/Q GaAs Mixers for Wideband and High Frequency Applications
full_text: Qorvo® introduced a family of compact Quadrature IF Mixers, or IQ Mixers, that address the needs of wideband and high frequency applications such as phased array radar, satellite communications and electronic warfare.

full_text: Within a short time SMP connectors from Rosenberger will be taking a long trip: the first ever LTE cellular network on the moon will be operational by the end of 2022.

title: Wideband HPA Delivers 37 dBm Consistently from S- through K-Band

title: Digitization of Satellite RF Systems
full_text: The past several years have seen wide upheaval in the space communication sector, from satellite payloads to ground station technology. This renaissance of space communications has largely been a shift from the five-decade-long approach of highly dedicated satellite communication and ground station technology to increased digitization and virtualization. A key aspect of this transformation is the digitization of satellite RF systems to yield more compact, lower weight, more configurable, and lower cost. Learn about this evolving trend.

title: First Direct Microwave Synthesis DAC with 26 GHz Output Bandwidth Now Sampling via Teledyne e2v
full_text: Teledyne e2v is sampling beta versions of its EV12DD700 dual-channel DACs. These wide output bandwidth 12- or 8-bit data converters handle sample rates to 12 GSPS, providing the capability to generate signal waveforms in multiple frequency bands and first to operate within Ka-Band.

title: Pentek Announces Design Win from Telemus for ELINT UAV Applications

full_text: Cambridge-based Plextek DTS has been named as one of the competition winners under the recent Defence and Security Accelerator (DASA) competition: “Windfarm Mitigation for UK Air Defence."

title: Frequency Matters, Oct 16: Oct Products, Interview with ADI, News/Events

title: The Future of Electronic Warfare Solutions
full_text: Ka-band in satellite communications plays an increasing important role today. However, at higher frequencies, electromagnetic wave absorption increases. At Ka-band frequencies this can lead to service interruptions and performance degradation during rain fades. With high atmospheric losses, conventional fade margin approaches such as adaptive-waveform techniques or adaptive-power control techniques are not sufficient for compensation. For reliable and highly available operations, only site diversity configurations on the ground provide an adequate, fail safe solutions.

full_text: Q-Tech Corporation introduces the QT625S/QT725S Series of space-qualified hybrid surface acoustic wave (SAW) crystal oscillators, offering satellite and space craft designers exceptional performance for geosynchronous orbit (GEO) and other deeper space applications requiring the utmost in tolerance to radiation.

title: BAE Systems Completes Acquisition of Airborne Tactical Radios Business
full_text: After reaching a definitive agreement in January,  BAE Systems  has completed the acquisition of  Raytheon Technologies’ airborne tactical radios business, based in Fort Wayne, Indiana, and Largo, Florida.

title: RFMW Receives Silver Tier Award from BAE Systems
full_text: Achieving a 99.85 percent quality and 98 percent delivery rating during 2019, RFMW has been recognized by BAE Systems with the 2019 Silver Tier Award for exceptional performance and contributions to supply chain success.

title: ThinKom Completes Successful Antenna Interoperability Demonstrations on Ku-Band LEO Satellite Constellation
full_text: ThinKom Solutions, Inc. recently completed a series of interoperability tests that demonstrated the compatibility of its core antenna technology with a low-Earth orbit (LEO) satellite network.

title: L3Harris Technologies Awarded Third LRIP Order on US Army's HMS Manpack IDIQ Contract
full_text: L3Harris Technologies has received a third low-rate initial production (LRIP) order valued at $95 million by the U.S. Army under the handheld, manpack and small form-fit (HMS) IDIQ contract to bring AN/PRC-158 multi-channel radios to the battlefield.

title: COMSAT Inks Deal with ABS to Enhance C- and Ku-Band U.S. Connectivity Solutions on ABS-3A
full_text: COMSAT Inc. has ratified an agreement with ABS to enhance and strengthen the COMSAT global network. The addition of the ABS-3A satellite to the COMSAT Southbury, Conn. teleport services bolsters its reach throughout the Americas, Europe, North Africa and the Middle East to provide more resilient and robust connectivity solutions through its terrestrial fiber pathways.

title: ETL Systems Extends Falcon Frequency Converter Range
full_text: ETL Systems has announced the addition of new frequency converter modules and extension of conversion frequencies covered by its Falcon range. The introduction of modules covering K, C, X, L and IF-Band conversions has expanded upon ETL’s existing Ka- and Ku-Band conversion offering.

title: Elbit Systems Awarded $103 Million to Supply Airborne Electronic Warfare Suites to Asian Country
full_text: Elbit Systems Ltd. announced that it was awarded a contract valued at approximately $103 million to supply comprehensive Electronic Warfare (EW) suites for an Air Force of an Asian country. Under the contract, Elbit Systems will fit the customer’s helicopters with complete EW suites, including countermeasure systems. The EW suites will provide the helicopters with advanced protection to achieve the customer’s operational requirements.

title: Thales Alenia Space to Develop in Spain the TDRS Transmitter for VEGA Launchers
full_text: Thales Alenia Space announced the signature of a contract with AVIO S.p.A., industrial prime contractor of VEGA launch vehicle, in the frame of LEAP1 program of the European Space Agency (ESA), concerning the initial phases of design, development and qualification of a tracking and data relay satellite (TDRS) transmitter, targeting an improvement of VEGA telemetry system both in terms of cost and performance.

title: Anokiwave and Ball Aerospace Collaborate on Flat-Panel Phased Arrays
full_text: Anokiwave and Ball Aerospace are collaborating to develop a new generation of SATCOM terminal antennas, with Anokiwave’s second-generation K- and Ka-Band silicon RFICs integrated with Ball’s electronically steerable K- and Ka-Band antennas.

title: Northrop Grumman's $165 Million Contract Finalizes Ninth Full Rate Production Lot of AARGM
full_text: The U.S. Navy awarded Northrop Grumman Corporation $165 million for Lot 9 full rate production (FRP) of the AGM-88E Advanced Anti-Radiation Guided Missile (AARGM). Assets will include all-up round missiles and captive air training missiles for the U.S. Navy and foreign military sales.

title: Rosenberger Releases New Brochure
full_text: A new brochure showcases Rosenberger’s highly reliable interconnect components and devices qualified for aerospace, security and defense applications.

title: Mercury Systems Announces SOSA-Aligned Ultra-Wideband Dual Microwave Up-Converter
full_text: Mercury Systems announced the SpectrumSeries™ RFM3103s wideband dual up-converter, which supports the sensor open systems architecture (SOSA) technical standard for electronic warfare (EW) environments. Mercury will accept orders for RFM3103s modules in the third quarter of this year.

title: Triad Amplified Radio Systems Extend Link Ranges Up to 10x
full_text: Triad RF Systems announced the launch of a line of Triad amplified radios that extend the range of the most widely used wireless mesh or mobile ad hoc network (MANET)/MIMO radios in the industry.

title: US Air Force Selects Raytheon Missiles & Defense to Develop Long-Range Standoff Weapon
full_text: The U.S. Air Force has selected Raytheon Missiles & Defense rather than Lockheed Martin to develop the Long-Range Standoff Weapon (LRSO), a strategic weapon that will replace the service’s legacy air-launched cruise missile.

title: Norsat International Launches New Ka-band Terminal in Its WAYFARER™ Series
full_text: Norsat International Inc. announced the launch of a new satellite antenna in its WAYFARER series of portable and easy-to-deploy commercial terminals. The new 1.2-meter auto-pointing fly-away antenna (“WFA120KA”) is a fast-deploying, easy-to-use and compact SATCOM VSAT that is airline checkable.

title: Teledyne e2v HiRel Unveils Family of High Power PIN Diode Limiter Modules
full_text: Teledyne e2v HiRel announced a new addition to its family of high power limiters, the TDLM202402, a quasi-active S-band SMT PIN Diode Limiter that offers “always on” high power CW and peak protection.

title: Infinite Electronics Receives Raytheon Technologies’ Supplier Excellence Award
full_text: Infinite Electronics, Inc., announced that it has received the 2019 Supplier Excellence Award from Raytheon Missiles and Defense for superior supplier performance, one of 36 companies recognized for three-star honors.

title: Pixus Announces Rugged Rackmount Chassis for Longer OpenVPX Modules
full_text: Pixus Technologies now offers MIL-rugged rackmount enclosures that support deeper modules than the standard 160mm depth of OpenVPX.

title: Anokiwave Appoints William Nevius VP/GM of the Aerospace & Defense Portfolio
full_text: Anokiwave has appointed William “Bill” Nevius as vice president and general manager of its aerospace and defense (A&D) portfolio. He will lead the development of strategic defense accounts to grow Anokiwave’s business in satellite communications, radar, EW, communications and space programs.

title: ThinKom Aero Satellite Antennas Fully Comply with International Non-Interference Rules
full_text: ThinKom Solutions, Inc., announced that its phased-array satellite antennas are in full compliance with the latest rules from international regulatory bodies governing evolving interference threats.

title: First Book Addressing RF Signals and Electronic Systems Releases
full_text: Artech House announced the publication of High-Power Electromagnetic Effects on Electronic Systems by D.V. Giri, Richard Hoad and Frank Sabath. This is the first book that comprehensively addresses the issues relating to the effects of radio frequency signals and the environment of electrical and electronic systems.

title: Raytheon Missile Defense Agency Sign Landmark $2 Billion Standard Missile-3 Contract
full_text: Raytheon Company will produce and deliver SM-3® Block IB interceptors under a $2.1 billion, multi-year U.S. Missile Defense Agency contract. It is the first multi-year contract for the SM-3 program and covers fiscal years 2019–2023.

title: Pentek’s Four-channel, 1.25 GHz D/A Jade Architecture XMC Ideal for Waveform Generation
full_text: Pentek, Inc., announced its most recent addition to the Jade® Architecture family, the Jade® Model 71871, a four-channel 1.25 GHz D/A converter XMC for RF and IF waveform generation.

title: Cobham Advanced Electronic Solutions Space Pedigree Aids in Coronavirus Fight
full_text: Cobham Advanced Electronic Solutions announced accelerated demand for its technology to be used for rapid sequencing of coronavirus samples for analysis and to aid in diagnosing and treating coronavirus patients.

title: OneWeb Files for Chapter 11 Restructuring to Execute Sale Process
full_text: OneWeb announced that the company and certain of its controlled affiliates have voluntarily filed for relief under Chapter 11 of the Bankruptcy Code in the U.S. Bankruptcy Court for the Southern District of New York. The company intends to use these proceedings to pursue a sale of its business in order to maximize the value of the company.

title: Protected Globally: AEHF-6 Satellite Actively Communicating With U.S. Space Force
full_text: The first national security launch for the U.S. Space Force and the final satellite to build out the protected communications constellation is now connected.The sixth Lockheed Martin-built Advanced Extremely High Frequency (AEHF-6) satellite adds increased resiliency and advanced capabilities to the AEHF-MILSTAR constellation which ensures the ability to transmit data anywhere, anytime.

title: Mini-Circuits Receives 10th Consecutive 4-Star Supplier Excellence Award from Raytheon IDS
full_text: For the 10th consecutive year, Mini-Circuits has received a 4-Star Supplier Excellence Award from longtime customer Raytheon Integrated Defense Systems. In 2019, Mini-Circuits supported Raytheon with 1,250 product models for production, development and prototyping — a 22 percent increase from 2018.

title: Georgia Tech Develops Room-Temp Process to Bond GaN to Diamond
full_text: A room-temperature bonding technique for integrating wide bandgap materials such as GaN with thermally conducting materials such as diamond is intended to improve GaN device cooling to achieve higher output power, improved reliability and reduced manufacturing costs.

title: Satellite 2020 Bucked the Trend
full_text: Satellite 2020 was one of the trade shows that was able to go ahead even though the last day of the exhibition was cancelled. The timing was just right that it occurred right before the major shutdowns in the US went into place. The keynote Monday afternoon was a “fireside chat” with Elon Musk as he was asked about many of his space ventures and plans for the future.

title: Northrop Grumman Corporation Completes Successful Demonstration of the (HAMMR) System
full_text: Northrop Grumman has completed a successful demonstration of the highly adaptable multi-mission radar (HAMMR) at Eglin Air Force Base, where it detected and tracked an unmanned aerial vehicle.

title: Missile Defense Agency’s Long Range Discrimination Radar Closer To Delivery
full_text: Lockheed Martin continues to successfully achieve all program milestones as it works towards delivering the radar to The Missile Defense Agency’s Long Range Discrimination Radar in 2020 by delivering the first ten antenna panels to Clear, Alaska, that will make up the first of the system’s two radar antenna arrays.

title: LM Awarded Contract to Develop Prototype Protected Tactical SATCOM Payload
full_text: Lockheed Martin was awarded a $240 million contract to develop a prototype payload for the U.S. Space Force’s Space and Missile Systems Center at Los Angeles Air Force Base's new protected tactical SATCOM system.

Offered in diameters up to four meters, the antenna is one-third the size and 50 percent the weight of previous designs. When stowed, the reflector is about the size of a commercial office fire extinguisher.

title: Mission Microwave Supports Envistacom SATCOM Terminal Upgrade Program
full_text: Spacecom, operator of the AMOS satellite fleet, and Get SAT, an innovator in small, lightweight satellite communication terminals for airborne, ground, and maritime applications, revealed that using AMOS-17’s steerable KA-band HTS beams and Get SAT’s miniaturized Micro-SAT satcom terminals, they have successfully tested and demonstrated full mobile broadband satcom capabilities for ISR (Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance) applications. Enabled by AMOS-17’s powerful KA-band HTS beams and extremely small terminals at both ends, the team created a small footprint, high capacity true tactical solution for deployed units.

full_text: Today, Qorvo announced it has completed the acquisition of Custom MMIC, a privately held supplier of high performance GaAs and GaN MMICs, primarily for defense and space applications. Custom MMIC founder Paul Blount will be a director of engineering within Qorvo's infrastructure and defense segment.

title: Qorvo® Completes Acquisition of Custom MMIC
full_text: Raytheon Company’s Mark Russell, vice president of engineering, technology and mission assurance, has been elected to the National Academy of Engineering (NAE). He was selected for his leadership in developing radar systems that enhance national security and safety.

title: Raytheon Executive Elected to National Academy of Engineering
full_text: With Qorvo completing the acquisition of Custom MMIC, Microwave Journal wanted to understand how Custom MMIC will merge into Qorvo. So we asked Roger Hall, general manager of Qorvo’s High Performance Solutions (HPS) business, and Paul Blount, the founder of Custom MMIC.

title: Custom MMIC Begins New Chapter As Part of Qorvo
full_text: Leonardo DRS, Inc. announced that it has been awarded a contract worth up to $808 million to provide a suite of electronic products to link C5ISR equipment to combat vehicles across the armed services and to satisfy interconnection requirements for federal agencies.

full_text: Comtech Telecommunications Corp. announced that during its second quarter of fiscal 2020, its New York-based subsidiary, Comtech PST Corp., which is part of Comtech’s Government Solutions segment, received a $3.1 million contract for high-power amplifier systems from a major domestic prime contractor.

title: Comtech Receives $3.1 M Contract for High-Power Amplifier Systems
full_text: Mercury Systems, Inc., a leader in trusted, secure mission-critical technologies for aerospace and defense, announced it received a $24 million order from a leading defense prime contractor for SWaP-optimized radio frequency (RF) modules ready for integration into an advanced electronic warfare system. The order was booked in the Company’s fiscal 2020 second quarter and is expected to be shipped over the next several quarters.

full_text: BAE Systems was awarded a contract from the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) to develop the next generation of mixed-signal electronics, combining advanced SiGe with advanced CMOS to enable ultra-wide bandwidth, high spurious-free dynamic range and fine data converter resolution with a high effective number of bits.

title: Pentek Announces New Quartz RFSoC Board
full_text: Pentek, Inc., introduced the Quartz™ Model 5550, an eight-channel A/D and D/A converter, 3U OpenVPX board based on the Xilinx Zynq UltraScale+ RFSoC and aligned to the SOSA™ Technical Standard. The Model 5550 is ideal for many communications, electro-optical, electronic warfare, radar and signals intelligence applications.

full_text: Microwave Journal editors Pat Hindle and Gary Lerude review the Jan Radar & Antennas issue products, industry news and upcoming events. Sponsored by Wireless Telecom Group.

title: BAE Announces Proposed Acquisition of Collins Aerospace's GPS, Raytheon's ATR Businesses
full_text: BAE Systems Inc. announced it has reached definitive agreements for the proposed acquisitions of Collins Aerospace’s military Global Positioning System (GPS) business and Raytheon’s Airborne Tactical Radios (ATR) business.

title: Harbour Industries Cables Approved for Use on F-35
full_text: Harbour Industries has been approved to manufacture low loss coaxial and high speed data cables for the F-35 Lightning II fighter, built by Lockheed Martin.

full_text: Kratos Defense & Security Solutions Inc. announced that it will participate in a multiple award IDIQ contract for U.S. Army advanced communication systems.

full_text: VadaTech announces the FMC259. The FMC259 is an FPGA Mezzanine Module per VITA 57.4 (FMC+) specification with dual Board-Mount Optical Assemblies, each providing 24 channel full-duplex transceivers capable of up to 28.1 Gb/s per channel (more than 1344 Gb/s total bi-directional).

title: VadaTech Announces 1344 Gb/s Fiber FMC+ Module

title: OneWeb, SatixFy to Launch Digital Tech Pathway Payload in 2021
full_text: OneWeb and SatixFy UK plan to add a full digital payload on OneWeb’s launch schedule during 2021, according to the companies. The digital system will demonstrate the capability to flexibly support regional peaks in user demand without increasing the size of OneWeb’s satellite constellation.

title: Horus: A Testbed for Fully Digital Phased Array Radars
full_text: Advantech Wireless Technologies Inc. has received over $2 million in orders of its Engage™ Class 1.2 and 2.4 m FlyAway SATCOM Terminal from a NATO member country.

full_text: Comtech Telecommunications Corp. announced that during its second quarter of fiscal 2020, its Orlando, Fla.-based subsidiary, Comtech Systems Inc., which is part of Comtech’s Government Solutions segment, was awarded a 10-year, $211 million IDIQ contract by the Cubic Mission Solutions business division of Cubic Corp. to provide next generation troposcatter systems in support of the U.S. Marine Corps.

title: Comtech Awarded $211M Contract to Supply Troposcatter Equipment
full_text: Elbit Systems Ltd. announced that it was awarded an initial contract from the Production and Procurement Directorate of the Israeli Ministry of Defense (IMOD) valued at approximately $31 million (NIS 109 million), to provide Iron Fist Active Protection Systems (APS) for the Eitan Armored Fighting Vehicles (AFV) of the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF).

title: Elbit Awarded $31M Contract from Israeli MOD to Supply Iron Fist Systems

title: Kratos Receives $24M Microwave Electronics Product Contract Award
full_text: Lockheed Martin (LM) delivered the 134th F-35 aircraft for the year, exceeding the joint government and industry 2019 delivery goal of 131 aircraft.

title: LM Delivers 134 F-35s in 2019, Exceeding Annual Commitment
full_text: Raytheon will build two additional shipsets of SPY-6 radars under a $250 million contract with the U.S. Navy.

title: Raytheon Building Additional SPY-6 Radars for US Navy
full_text: Smiths Interconnect has opened a qualification and test laboratory at its site in Dundee, Scotland. The lab will provide complete qualification testing for Smiths Interconnect products in Europe.

full_text: Kratos Defense & Security Solutions Inc. announced that it had been awarded a $39 million sole-source contract for Geolocation Global Support Services.

full_text: Comtech Telecommunications Corp. announced that during the second quarter of fiscal 2020, its subsidiary, Comtech Xicom Technology Inc., received orders totaling $3.6 million for Solid-State Power Amplifiers (SSPA) to be used in airborne, In-Flight Connectivity (IFC) applications.

title: L3Harris Receives $50M Follow-On Order for HF Radios from US Marine Corps
full_text: L3Harris Technologies has received a $50 million follow-on delivery order for Falcon III AN/PRC-160 HF radios and related equipment from the U.S. Marine Corps as part of its High Frequency Radio II modernization program.

title: GenXComm Announces Contract with US Army Futures Command’s Army Applications Laboratory
full_text: GenXComm Inc. announced that the U.S. Army Futures Command has awarded a contract with its Army Applications Laboratory (AAL) to GenXComm to adapt the company’s commercial analog interference cancellation technology to Army tactical systems.

title: Teledyne e2v HiRel Introduces Radiation Tolerant 2.5 GHz, 100 W RF Power Limiter
full_text: Teledyne e2v HiRel announced the availability of a new RF power limiter, the 2.5 GHz, 100 W TDLM025100.

title: QuadSAT Antenna Testing Successfully Demonstrated to SES and Eutelsat
full_text: QuadSAT has announced its antenna testing solution has been demonstrated to satellite operators SES and Eutelsat.

title: GD Electric Boat Awarded $22.2B by US Navy for 5th Block of Virginia-Class Submarines
full_text: The U.S. Navy awarded General Dynamics Electric Boat a contract valued at $22.2 billion for the construction of nine new Virginia-class submarines.

title: 5G Drives mmWave Technology Across Multiple Industries
full_text: The technology in today’s world continues to move higher in frequency to solve problems and improve performance. It is these millimeter wave (mmWave) frequencies that offer hope in solving the toughest requirements in many industries such as communications and defense. 5G communication systems benefit from years of research done by defense companies for different applications but similar needs.

title: GDMS Receives $731.8M Contract for Next-Gen SATCOM System
full_text: General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) announced  that it has been awarded a $731.8 million cost-plus-award-fee and firm-fixed-price indefinite delivery/indefinite quantity sole-source contract for the Mobile User Objective System (MUOS) ground system sustainment.

title: NGC, MBDA, Saab Demo Integration of Disparate Missile/Radar Systems into IAMD Battle Manager
full_text: Northrop Grumman Corp. (NGC), MBDA and Saab have successfully completed a joint, collaborative effort to demonstrate the ability to integrate MBDA’s Common Anti-air Modular Missile (CAMM) family and Saab’s Giraffe radar system family into Northrop Grumman’s Integrated Air and Missile Defense (IAMD) Battle Command System (IBCS).

title: Echodyne Radars Anchor DARPA's Urban Drone Testing
full_text: Echodyne announced that its radars were key active sensors deployed by the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) for its Aerial Dragnet program in San Diego during the week of October 21, 2019.

title: Leonardo Signs 'Maximum Availability' Support Contract for Radars Used in USAF Adversary Training
full_text: Leonardo has signed a multi-year, performance-based logistics contract with Draken International to ensure a high availability rate for the Grifo-L radars used to train U.S. Air Force (USAF) pilots.

title: Japan Protected with SPY-7, LM's Latest Generation Radar Technology
full_text: Lockheed Martin and its trading partner in Japan were recently contracted by the Japanese Ministry of Defense to produce two solid-state radar antenna sets to protect Japan against ballistic missile threats.

title: ThinKom Satellite Antennas Deliver Competitive Edge to Racing Teams in Bridgestone World Solar Challenge
full_text: ThinKom Solutions Inc. played a key role in providing vital satellite connectivity for two of the top competitors in the recent Bridgestone World Solar Challenge.

title: Special Ops Forces in Europe Obtain VSAT COTM Due to NCI4 & Get SAT
full_text: NIC4 Inc. and Get SAT have teamed to provide Very Small Aperture Terminal (VSAT) Comms-on-the-Move (COTM) network and equipment services to Special Operations Forces in Europe.

full_text: Pentek Inc. introduced the newest member of the Jade™ family of high performance data converter 3U VPX modules based on the Xilinx Kintex Ultrascale FPGA.

full_text: L3Harris Technologies has been awarded a program to develop and test an integrated digital radar warning receiver for the U.S. Air Force’s F-16 multi-role fighter. Northrop Grumman received a similar award.

title: Mercury Systems' Solutions Selected by Raytheon for LTAMDS Radar Program

title: Raytheon's Next Generation Jammer Air Turbine Completes Initial Flight Testing
full_text: Raytheon completed the first power generation flight test of the air turbine generator on the Next Generation Jammer Mid-Band (NGJ-MB), successfully demonstrating the jammer can generate its own power.

title: Teledyne Paradise Unveils Pulsed SSPA for Upgrading Aging Radar Tech Platforms
full_text: Teledyne Paradise Datacom, part of the Teledyne Defense Electronics Group, is unveiling a new Pulsed Radar SSPA that is designed for operators of defense-related tactical radar systems.

title: Blighter Secures Major Funding to Expand Customer Base for Radar and Counter-Drone Solutions
full_text: Blighter Surveillance Systems Ltd. has secured a significant growth capital loan from BOOST&Co to further exploit the success of its advanced radars and counter-drone solutions for use by airports, nuclear power stations, oil/gas processing plants and other critical national infrastructure sites.

title: X-37B Breaks Record, Lands After 780 Days in Orbit
full_text: The Air Force’s X-37B Orbital Test Vehicle Mission 5 successfully landed at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center Shuttle Landing Facility October 27, 2019 at 3:51 a.m.

title: Keysight Delivers Dynamic Real-Time Threat Simulation EW Test Capabilities
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced new electronic warfare (EW) threat simulation solutions, including software and hardware, that generate modern EW RF environments to enable engineers to easily and efficiently test their EW systems.

title: CRFS Launches Portable, High-Fidelity RF Recorder
full_text: CRFS announced the launch of its new RFeye SenS Portable, a small, lightweight, high-fidelity RF recorder for long-duration signal recording and playback, with applications in defense, manufacturing and telecommunications.

title: Raytheon Receives $33M Navy Contract to Develop Towed Decoy for the F/A-18
full_text: The U.S. Navy has awarded Raytheon a $33 million contract to develop a dual band towed decoy for the F/A-18 E/F.

title: 2019 IEEE International Symposium on Phased Array Systems and Technology
full_text: Phased array systems continue to be a rapidly evolving technology with steady advances motivated by the challenges presented to modern military and commercial applications. This year, the conference had a significant amount of commercial content as phased arrays are being designed and produced for mmWave 5G applications from fixed wireless access to repeaters to small cells.

title: BAE Systems Awarded $37M Navy Contract to Develop Towed Decoy

title: OMS Captures Passive Microwave Temperature Soundings of Typhoon Hagibis

The data showed Typhoon Hagibis strengthening dramatically, representing the greatest intensification of a Western Pacific storm since Typhoon Yates in 1996.

title: Military Satellite Terminals RF Technology Trends and Outlook

title: Defense Opportunities and Challenges in 2019
full_text: Active antennas, or phased arrays, have been widely used for many years. The first phased array applications were mainly military with systems deployed as early as the mid-1970s. Recent industry trends have shown a rapid increase in the use of this technology for both radar and communication systems, along with a push into the mmWave spectrum. This paper will explain the market changes behind these trends and the implications for the future.

The ADRV9008 is a two-chip transceiver (i.e., one each for transmit and receive) for frequency-division duplex (FDD) systems, and the ADRV9009 is a single chip transceiver for time-division duplex (TDD) systems.

full_text: Leonardo DRS Inc. announced an addition to its popular Vesper family of small, high performance RF monitoring and detection tuners.

title: ALMA, VLT Find Too Many Massive Stars in Starburst Galaxies, Near and Far
full_text: Astronomers using ALMA and the VLT have discovered that both starburst galaxies in the early universe and a star-forming region in a nearby galaxy contain a much higher proportion of massive stars than is found in more peaceful galaxies.

title: R&S Presents Solutions for Secure Communications in Tactical Deployment
full_text: System solutions for secure communications from Rohde & Schwarz allow customers to attain information superiority in deployment and digital sovereignty.

title: Teledyne e2v First Semiconductor Manufacturer in Europe to Receive QML Class Y
full_text: Teledyne e2v is the first semiconductor manufacturer in Europe, and only third in the world, to be awarded the site level MIL-PRF-38535 Class Y certification from the DLA.

title: US Navy Selects Naval Strike Missile As New, Over-the-Horizon Weapon
full_text: The U.S. Navy has selected the Naval Strike Missile, offered by Raytheon Co. and Kongsberg Gruppen, to meet its over-the-horizon requirement for littoral combat ships and future frigates.

title: ADI Introduces Industry’s Most Advanced PLL/VCO Solution
full_text: Analog Devices Inc. (ADI) announced a state-of-the-art synthesizer consisting of a phase-locked loop (PLL) with fully integrated voltage controlled oscillator (VCO) as well as integrated low dropout regulators (LDO) and integrated tracking filter technology.

title: Keysight Launches Highly Scalable Channel Emulation Solution
full_text: Keysight Technologies  announced the PROPSIM MANET Channel Emulation Solution for emulating the end-to-end performance and interoperability of mobile ad-hoc networks and mesh radio systems used in tactical, mission critical wireless communications.

title: AtlanTecRF’s Ku-Band Drone Satellite Simulator Takes Maiden Flight
full_text: U.K.-based SATCOM RF Test company, AtlanTecRF is delighted to announce the first flight of its newly released Ku-Band Drone Satellite Simulator specifically designed to enable the testing of ocean going SATCOM systems.

full_text: ThinKom Solutions Inc. has announced that its phased-array antennas are fully interoperable with the next generation of low-earth orbit (LEO) and mid-earth orbit (MEO) networks as well as geostationary (GEO) satellites.

title: mmWave IGBs™, Anokiwave’s Latest in Family of Single Channel Versatile Si ICs
full_text: Continuing to redefine the traditional single function gain block, Anokiwave is releasing two new ICs in a family of multi-function microwave and mmWave silicon ICs, offering transmit/receive functionality with active gain and phase control.

title: Integra's Fully-Matched RF Power Transistor Offers 25 W of Power
full_text: Integra Technologies has announced a new, fully-matched, GaN on SiC RF power transistor developed for C-Band applications. It is rated for CW operation.

title: ADI's RF ADC Sets New Performance Benchmarks for Instrumentation, Defense
full_text: Analog Devices Inc. (ADI) introduced a 12-bit RF analog-to-digital converter (ADC) that delivers industry-leading speed and bandwidth. The new AD9213 features higher parametric performance: greater Nyquist bandwidth and RF sampling capabilities at higher analog input frequencies than conventional RF ADCs, allowing for the digitization of RF signals up to 7 GHz.

title: New Technical Book by Hal Altan Published
full_text: A new technical book “Telemetry Communications Systems Simplified” by Hal Altan, has been published and is available on Amazon.com.

full_text: Analog Devices Inc. (ADI) introduced a highly integrated, active antenna beamforming chip that allows designers to quickly replace bulky, mechanically-steered antenna platforms with a compact, solid-state solution for phased array radar and communications systems.

title: Thales Kicks Off Production on Supersonic Missile-Tracking Sensor
full_text: Production has begun for the Sea Fire digital radar, a naval sensor designed to track new weapons including supersonic missiles, Thales said.

title: Qorvo Ends Fiscal 2018 With Positive Momentum
full_text: Strong demand in Wi-Fi, IoT and defense, coupled with improving demand from China's handset manufacturers, grew Qorvo’s Q4 revenue to $665 million, up 3.5 percent compared to last years’s quarter. For the full year, Qorvo reported just under $3 billion in revenue, down 2 percent from fiscal 2017.

title: Mercury Receives $3.8M mmWave Microelectronics Order for Homeland Security Application
full_text: Mercury Systems Inc. announced it received a $3.8 million order from a leading electronics manufacturing services provider for millimeter wave transceiver subsystems integrated into a high-resolution imaging system used for homeland security.

title: Teledyne e2v Announces Most Advanced Quad-Channel ADC
full_text: Teledyne e2v has released its most advanced analog-to-digital converter (ADC) — the EV12AQ600. This new ADC can operate as a single-, dual- or quad-channel device and includes a radiation-tolerant version, making it the first quad-channel ADC suitable for space applications.

title: Pickering Interfaces PXI Switching Module Selected for A-10C Aircraft Ground Support
full_text: Pickering Interfaces announced that the U.S. Air Force, Ogden Air Logistics Complex at Hill AFB, Utah, recently awarded them a contract for a large quantity of their 6U High-Density Matrix modules (model 45-542) for the PXI switching requirement that is part of the PATS-70A (Portable Automated Test Set) for the O-Level and I-Level maintenance of A-10C aircraft.

title: Establishing Freedom of Action will Propel Electronic Warfare Market Opportunities
full_text: Operational requirements to establish freedom of action in contested and congested environments, as well as being able to counter modern agile radar and communications will drive opportunities for the Electronic Warfare (EW) market. The Strategy Analytics Advanced Defense Systems (ADS) service report forecasts the global EW market will grow to $20.0 billion by 2027.

title: Micro Harmonics Introduces 58-64 GHz Circulator, Extends Isolators to 325 GHz
full_text: Micro Harmonics, a small business specializing in ferrite-based millimeter wave components, announced the availability of its initial circulator product, the YC148, covering 58 to 64 GHz. The company is also extending its line of Faraday rotation isolators from WR12 (60 to 90 GHz) to WR3.4 (220 to 325 GHz). Prototypes of WR5.1, WR4.3 and WR3.4 designs are being evaluated and will be released by summer.

title: Raytheon Awarded $136M for AMDR Production, Funding Fourth Ship Set
full_text: Raytheon was awarded a $136 million production contract for the AN/SPY-6(V)1 Air and Missile Defense Radar (AMDR), the U.S. Navy’s next-generation integrated air and missile defense radar. The award is an option under the current low rate initial production contract and will fund the fourth “ship set” of radar mission equipment.

title: Thales Alenia Space, SWISSto12 Enter into Agreement
full_text: Thales Alenia Space and SWISSto12 entered into agreement during the Satellite 2018 show in Washington, D.C. Both companies will work and innovate together by setting up a novel supply chain of spacecraft waveguides.

title: Can Phased Arrays Calibrate on Noise?
full_text: Is it possible that a broadband noise source could be used to calibrate an array of receivers?  Noise has many features that lends it to a calibration waveform.   Noise can excite many frequencies simultaneously and is already used in known methods for adaptive filter algorithms. Find out the answer in this expert advice article.

title: CMSE Conference Offers Insight into Current Issues of Military/Space Electronic Components

title: Tactical Targeting Network Technology
full_text: If data protection is critical to home users in terms of warding off things like identity theft and fraud, think of how critical it is when you're talking about data being transmitted from an aircraft traveling in excess of one thousand miles per hour to command crews on the ground. When something as essential as national security is on the line, you cannot leave anything to chance in terms of reliability and security - which are exactly the types of concerns that Tactical Targeting Network Technology were designed to address.

title: It’s Time to Convert EW Radio Designs
full_text: Recent developments within the high speed converter industry have enabled the fabrication of 28 nm process converters. Using smaller processes is especially beneficial in EW systems, where large bandwidth, high agility and low SWaP are required, enabling the integration of multiple ADCs and DACs within a single package to reduce power consumption.

full_text: This paper was an Outstanding Paper Award finalist in RADAR at EDI CON USA 2017.

title: Empower RF Systems Announce New HF Communications, Jamming Transmitter
full_text: Empower RF is announcing the availability of their fielded Model 2203 high power amplifier, which operates from 1 to 30 MHz and delivers a minimum of 1 KW CW. The 2203 is capable of operating in multi-domain scenarios as a jamming or communications transmitter with any type of modulation (AM, FM, multi-tone, pulse, PSK, FSK and complex digital modulation).

title: ViaSat-2 Commercial Service Planned for February, Despite Antenna Issue

title: Antenna Technologies for the Future

title: Old Crows Flock to DC for 54th Convention
full_text: The Association of Old Crows (AOC) held the organization’s fifty-fourth convention and symposium in Washington, D.C. the week of November 27, 2017. The event attracted 1,633 attendees, almost a 30 percent increase from 2016, and 107 exhibitors, a 10 percent increase from 2016, with 25 countries represented. Microwave Journal’s Mike Hallman and Gary Lerude toured the exhibition to get a pulse on how the RF/microwave industry is supporting EW system requirements.

title: NGC Awarded $124.7M for AN/APR-39D(V)2 Digital Radar Warning Receiver, EW Management Systems

title: Kymeta and Intelsat Launch KĀLO Mobile Internet Service

title: It’s Not Just About SWaP Any Longer
full_text: To address the challenges of miniaturization and increased density of components in a given volume, the industry has focused on reducing size, weight and power (SWaP). This long-running approach is beginning to see limits in foundry and packaging processes and the continued SWaP progression. Two key factors are behind this.
