full_text: Harris Corporation has completed development of the company’s fully digital Mission Data Unit (MDU), which is at the heart of its navigation payload for Lockheed Martin’s GPS III satellites 11 and beyond.

title: How Software-Defined Spectrum Analysis is Advancing Spectrum Monitoring and SIGINT Applications
full_text: A new generation of Software-Defined Spectrum Analysis solutions has been developed. By being based on software-defined radio innovation, these solutions are able to provide the frequency and performance required in a compact, versatile, and cost-effective unit, and they can be quickly upgraded or adjusted for a wide variety of deployment scenarios. This gives users the flexibility and versatility needed to adapt to changing signal processing and analysis requirements without undergoing a full hardware upgrade.

title: RF GaN Market Nearing $750 Million

Growth in defense applications, particularly radar, communications and EW, will offset flat revenue from the wireless infrastructure segment.

title: TE Connectivity's New Circular Connectors Authorized for Nett Warrior Program

title: Harris to Develop Battlespace Communications Network for Asia-Pacific Country

title: Xilinx Delivers Zynq UltraScale+ RFSoC Family Integrating the RF Signal Chain
full_text: Xilinx announced delivery of its Zynq® UltraScale+™ RF SoC family, a breakthrough architecture integrating the RF signal chain into an SoC for 5G wireless, cable remote-PHY and radar. Based on a 16 nm UltraScale+ MPSoC architecture, the programmable RF SoCs monolithically integrate RF data converters, for up to 50–75 percent system power and footprint reduction, and soft-decision forward error correction (SD-FEC) cores to meet 5G and DOCSIS 3.1 standards. With silicon samples already shipping to multiple customers, the early access program for the Zynq UltraScale+ RF SoC family is now available.

title: DARPA's New Radar Sensor Provides Clear Vision in Any Weather

title: AXIe Consortium Announce Optical Communication Standard for Instrumentation Systems

The AXIe Consortium was joined by Conduant Corporation, Guzik Technical Enterprises, Intel Corporation, Keysight Technologies, Samtec Incorporated and Xilinx in endorsing the standard and stating their plans to offer components or instrumentation products compliant with the new standard.

title: Physical Size Allocations for RF Electronics in Digital Beamforming Phased Arrays
full_text: There are many challenges associated with the migration to near elemental digital beamforming for AESAs. The challenges range from calibration, digital control, distribution of clocks, LO, power, processing the volume of data and the physical size constraints of the electronics. The prolific advancement of RFICs for the wireless industry continues to enable the ability for higher levels of integration in RF designs and now practical implementations of every element digital beamforming arrays is becoming a reality. In this article, we focus on the physical size requirements for the electronics. The physical size requirements as a function of the operating frequency are discussed and practical implementation methods are reviewed.

full_text: Leonardo is to provide Seaspray 5000E AESA radars for two new production model Dornier 228 multirole aircraft, recently ordered by the Bangladesh Navy.

title: HENSOLDT Takes Over EuroAvionics
full_text: German sensor house HENSOLDT has taken over EuroAvionics GmbH, a supplier of avionics systems for helicopters and UAVs.

title: TMD Introduces two new MPMs for Radar and EW at DSEi 2017
full_text: TMD Technologies Limited (TMD) will introduce the new the PTX8110 and PTX8815 TWT based microwave power modules at DSEi 2017.

title: Akoustis Ships S-Band BAW Filter Prototypes
full_text: BAW filter start-up Akoustis Technologies shipped first prototypes of an S-Band BAW bandpass filter for a military radar application. The filter has a 100 MHz passband between 3.5 and 3.9 GHz.

title: AMDR Successfully Tracks Complex Target in Second Ballistic Missile Test
full_text: Raytheon Company’s AN/SPY-6(V) Air and Missile Defense Radar (AMDR) successfully searched for, acquired and tracked a ballistic missile test target during its second live-target flight test at the U.S. Navy's Pacific Missile Range Facility at Kauai, Hawaii.

title: Military Communications and RF Security
full_text: Military Communications, particularly radios and unmanned system radios, continue to be driven towards wider bandwidth, reduced size, weight and power (SWaP) and more dynamic access to the available spectrum. However, a key component that must also be enhanced, to maximize operational effectiveness, is communication security.

title: ADI Announces 3 to 20 GHz Double Balanced Mixer
full_text: Analog Devices, Inc., which recently acquired Linear Technology Corporation, announces the LTC5552, a double balanced mixer that features wideband matching from 3 to 20 GHz.

title: Patriot One Completes FCC, IC Submission in Preparation for PATSCAN CMR Commercialization
full_text: Patriot One Technologies Inc. is pleased to announce that its award-winning PATSCAN CMR™ (Cognitive Microwave Radar) concealed weapons detection system has met Federal Communications Commission (FCC) and Industry Canada (IC) regulatory requirements, as verified through a series of tests by an accredited third party laboratory.

title: Anaren, Inc. Receives Premier Supplier Excellence Award from Raytheon
full_text: Anaren Microwave has received the Premier Supplier Excellence Award for technical innovation from Raytheon. The award is given to less than 0.5 percent of the overall supplier base for Raytheon — only nine suppliers worldwide.

title: BAE Systems Unveils Innovative Multiple-Object Tracking Radar for Test Ranges
full_text: BAE Systems introduced iMOTR™, a mobile multiple-object tracking radar for military test and evaluation ranges, which uses COTS solutions.

title: AtlanTecRF Launches Ultra-Broadband Digital Attenuator
full_text: AtlanTecRF launched its latest ultra-broadband 500 MHz to 20 GHz digitally-controlled PIN attenuator.

title: Lockheed Martin Invests $350M in State-of-the-Art Satellite Production Facility
full_text: Preliminary construction is underway on a new $350 million Lockheed Martin facility near Denver that will produce next-generation satellites.

title: OPTSAT-3000 Earth Observation Satellite Launched
full_text: The Italian Ministry of Defense’s OPTSAT-3000 satellite has been successfully launched by Arianespace from the Kourou European spaceport in the French Guyana.

title: Rockwell Collins Awarded U.S. Army Follow-On Order for 101 HMS Manpack Radios
full_text: The U.S. Army's Program Executive Office C3T has selected Rockwell Collins to produce 101 handheld, manpack and small form factor (HMS) radios and ancillaries beginning this month.

title: Comtech Awarded $7.5M Order for GaN PAs for In-Flight Connectivity
full_text: Comtech Xicom Technology received a $7.5 million follow-on order for GaN solid-state power amplifiers (SSPA) that will be used for commercial airborne, in-flight connectivity. Comtech's GaN SSPAs will help to enable high speed satellite connectivity for both airlines and travelers around the world.

title: Boeing Team Completes KC-46 Tanker Electromagnetic Testing
full_text: A Boeing-led team, including U.S. Air Force and Naval Air Systems Command representatives, recently completed KC-46 tanker electromagnetic testing.

title: Teledyne Labtech to Supply Advanced RF/Microwave PCB Technology for AESA Radar
full_text: Teledyne Labtech, a U.K.-based business unit of Teledyne Microwave Solutions, announced that it has secured a new supply contract worth over £11 million as part of an agreement with international aerospace, defence and security company Leonardo.

title: Mercury Systems Receives $5.5M Order for Weapons Application
full_text: Mercury Systems, Inc. announced it received a $5.5 million follow-on order from a leading defense prime contractor for compact, highly ruggedized, system-in-package (SiP) devices for an airborne weapons application.

title: Mercury Systems Receives $6.3M Order for Next-Generation Surveillance Radar Processing
full_text: Mercury Systems, Inc. announced it received a $6.3 million order from a leading defense prime contractor for radar processing products.

title: Counter-IED Market Worth US$2.03B by 2022
full_text: The report "Counter-IED Market by End User, Deployment , Capability and Region—Global Forecast to 2022", the counter-IED market is projected to grow from US$1.78 billion in 2017 to US$2.03 billion by 2022, at a CAGR of 2.64 percent during the forecast period from 2017 to 2022.

title: A-INFO Releases Electric Double Ridge Waveguide Switch
full_text: A-INFO is pleased to introduce a family of waveguide switches for applications from 4.75 to 40 GHz available in double ridge waveguide sizes.

title: Mercury Systems Receives $10.5M RF Seeker Order for Precision Guided Munitions
full_text: Mercury Systems, Inc. announced it received a $10.5 million follow-on order from a leading defense prime contractor for high performance microwave transceivers for precision guided munitions.

title: Leonardo DRS Wins Contract to Develop Counter-Drone Capability for U.S. Army
full_text: Leonardo DRS announced that it has received a contract award from the U.S. Army for up to $16 million, under an urgent operational need, to develop a counter-unmanned aerial system (C-UAS) capability to protect soldiers from enemy drones.

title: Pentek Boosts Bandwidth for Record, Playback of Talon Rugged Series Recorders
full_text: Pentek, Inc. introduced a new addition to the Talon® Series of recorders, the Model RTR 2745 rugged rackmount recorder.

full_text: Mercury Systems, Inc. announced it received the Premier Supplier Excellence Award from Raytheon.

full_text: The nanosatellite and microsatellite market is expected to grow from US$1.21 billion in 2017 to US$3.49 billion by 2022, at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 23.7 percent from 2017 to 2022.

title: DLS Increases Tactical Radio Production for U.S. Navy and Coalition Forces

title: Iridium Marks New Satellite Network, 20 Healthy Satellites, 55 More to Launch
full_text: With just 20 satellites of the Iridium Next constellation in orbit, Iridium Communications’ six remaining launches with SpaceX over the next year will place their entire 75 satellite network into polar orbit.

title: Lockheed Martin Awarded $73.8M for Phase 2 of the LRPF Program
full_text: Lockheed Martin received a $73.8 million contract from the U.S. Army for Phase 2 of the Long Range Precision Fires (LRPF) program.

full_text: Kratos Defense & Security Solutions, Inc. announced that its Unmanned Systems Division (USD) was awarded an amendment to a previously awarded contract to exercise an option for Low Rate Initial Production Year 1 (LRIP 1) from the U.S. Navy, for BQM-177A Subsonic Aerial Target (SSAT) Drone Systems.

full_text: Mercury Systems, Inc. announced it received an $8M follow-on order from a leading defense prime contractor for state-of-the-art GPS Selective Availability Anti-Spoofing Modules (SAASM) for a precision guided munitions program.

title: Akoustis Acquires STC-MEMS, Gaining BAW Manufacturing Facility
full_text: Mobile filter start-up Akoustis Technologies completed the acquisition of STC-MEMS, a semiconductor wafer manufacturing operation and microelectromechanical systems (MEMS) business in Canandaigua, New York. The acquisition enables Akoustis to internally manufacture its single-crystal BAW filters.

full_text: Raytheon announced that the company’s active electronically scanned array (AESA) radars for fighter aircraft have accumulated more than 1 million flight hours, aggregating the hours from two U.S. services and four international customers.

full_text: Pivotal Commware announced its initial round of funding of $17 million. Pivotal spun out from Intellectual Ventures in 2016 as the exclusive licensee of IV's metamaterials technology for terrestrial communications markets such as defense, cellular and vehicles (e.g., planes, cars, ships, trains and drones).

full_text: Bliley Technologies announced that they revealed their new OCXO, Poseidon 2, at IMS2017. Poseidon 2 will be a great, low-cost version of their original Poseidon.

full_text: At EW Europe Leonardo launched the new BriteEye integrated RF protection system, which provides end-to-end protection from radar-guided threats in a single system.

full_text: The inaugural flight of the C919, China's first domestically produced single-aisle passenger jet, has ushered in a new level of technological advancement and production efficiency in the commercial aircraft industry.

title: GORE™ SKYFLEX™ Aerospace Materials Part of COMAC C919 First Flight
full_text: AtlanTecRF has launched a plug-in 6U Loop Test Translator (LTT) for satcom RF testing. The traditional configuration for loop test translators used in off-satellite set up, calibration, alignment and quality monitoring of ground based equipment in satcom terminals is the 19” x 1U rack mount chassis. In other applications such packaging does not deliver optimum equipment densities or ease of operation. In such situations AtlanTecRF's plug-in 6U Module comes into its own, bringing ATE stacking principles to the satcom RF test world.

full_text: Microsemi Corporation announced a new family of wideband plastic packaged and chip MMICs: four plastic packaged low noise amplifiers, a wideband power amplifier (PA), and two plastic packaged switches.

title: Rocket and Missile Market Worth US$70 Billion by 2022
full_text: The rocket and missile market is projected to grow from US$55.53 billion in 2017 to US$70 billion by 2022, at a CAGR of 4.74 percent during the forecast period from the report "Rocket and Missile Market - Global Forecast to 2022".

title: TI Introduces 6.4 GSPS, 12-Bit ADC and 15 GHz PLL with VCO For Next-Gen Systems
full_text: Texas Instruments (TI) introduced an analog-to-digital converter (ADC) and phase-locked loop (PLL) with an integrated voltage-controlled oscillator (VCO) that deliver the widest bandwidth, lowest phase noise and highest dynamic range in the industry.

title: Raytheon EKV Succeeds in First Intercept of ICBM
full_text: A Raytheon Company upgraded Exoatmospheric Kill Vehicle, or EKV, a kinetic-force weapon that slams into its targets, destroyed an intercontinental ballistic missile for the first time during a Missile Defense Agency test of the Ground-based Midcourse Defense system.

title: Custom MMIC Awarded 4-Star Supplier Excellence Award by Raytheon
full_text: Custom MMIC is proud to announce their recognition by Raytheon Company, one of 84 companies recognized by Raytheon’s Integrated Defense Systems business for 4-star honors.

title: Teledyne Awarded Contract to Supply Filters, Diplexers for Space Payloads
full_text: Teledyne Defence & Space announced that it has been selected to manufacture over 5,000 filters and diplexers to support a space payload application for a large satellite program.

title: Raytheon's Proposed GaN AESA Upgrade to Patriot Completes 1,000 Hour Testing
full_text: Raytheon Company's newest integrated air and missile defense radar has accumulated more than 1,000 hours of operation since its debut at the 2016 Winter AUSA tradeshow. The proposed upgrade to the Patriot radar uses a GaN-powered active electronically scanned array.

title: NGC Demos HAMMR Multi-Mission AESA Radar During C-RAM Test
full_text: The U.S. Army selected Northrop Grumman Corporation’s Highly Adaptable Multi-Mission Radar (HAMMR) to demonstrate its multi-mission capability at the 2017 counter-rocket, artillery and mortar (C-RAM) test at the Yuma Proving Ground earlier this year. HAMMR is a multi-mission sensor that supports situational awareness, counter-fire operations, air defense, early warning and airspace management.

title: US, Japanese Firms Collaborating on New Missile Defense Radars
full_text: Raytheon Co and Lockheed Martin Corp are working with Japanese partners on rival projects to develop new radars that will enhance Japan's shield against any North Korean missile strike, according to government and defense industry sources. Raytheon is allied with Mitsubishi Electric Corp on the project while Lockheed is working with Fujitsu Ltd.

title: Air Flow-By Cooling Technology from Mercury Systems Achieves TRL-8
full_text: Mercury Systems, Inc. announced that systems using ANSI/VITA 48.7 Air Flow-By™ standard cooling technology have passed flight tests in multiple manned and unmanned airborne platforms, some in their final mission configuration, thereby achieving technology readiness level 8 (TRL-8).

title: Wolfspeed Develops the First 50 V GaN MMICs for S-Band Radar Applications
full_text: Wolfspeed, a Cree Company has introduced two new GaN MMICs, the first 50 V GaN devices specifically designed for S-Band radar (2.7 to 3.5 GHz).

title: AtlanTecRF Launches Q-Band Loop Test Translators
full_text: AtlanTecRF has launched its range of Q-Band Loop Test Translators with Ethernet Control. Addressing the nominal  44 GHz uplink market the company’s three new products provide loop-back frequency conversion of Transmit (Tx) to Receive (Rx), Transmit to L-Band and L-Band to Receive, thereby providing a complete suite of system testing instruments.

title: Microlease Introduces Aerospace and Defence Tool Box
full_text: The new Aerospace and Defence Tool Box from Microlease streamlines access to specially selected sets of equipment and test gear.

full_text: Terma supplies helicopter mission control system comprising the SCANTER 6002 Air and Surface Surveillance radar with IFF and the C-Flex Mission System.

full_text: Analog Devices, Inc. (ADI) introduced a series of wideband, passive, in-phase quadrature RF mixers.

full_text: Microsemi Corporation announced the company’s 60th anniversary of its products being used in space missions and its legacy of leadership in developing innovative solutions for the thriving space market.

full_text: Raytheon Co. has been awarded a $52.7 million fixed-price-incentive (firm target) contract for the engineering and manufacturing development (EMD) of the Three-Dimensional Expeditionary Long-Range Radar (3DELRR).

full_text: Pasternack has introduced 28 waveguide electromechanical relay switches that offer full waveguide performance covering C, X, Ku, K and Ka frequency bands from 5.85 to 40 GHz. They are ideal for applications that include electronic warfare, electronic countermeasures, microwave radio, VSAT, SATCOM, radar, research and development, space systems and test instrumentation.

title: US Navy's Enterprise Air Surveillance Radar Completes Major Design Review
full_text: Raytheon Company and the U.S. Navy conducted the Preliminary Design Review for the new Enterprise Air Surveillance Radar, confirming system development is on track for delivery to the designated ship classes.

title: Analog Devices’ 28 nm DAC Sets Performance Benchmarks
full_text: Analog Devices, Inc. (ADI) introduced a 28 nm digital-to-analog converter (DAC) as part of a series of high speed DACs. The AD9172 meets the demands of gigahertz bandwidth applications and delivers the increased spectral efficiency needed for 4G / 5G multi-band wireless communications base stations and 2 GHz E-Band microwave point-to-point backhaul radios. Its design benefits production instrumentation targeting multi-standard direct-to-RF signal synthesis and provides a solution for defense electronics requiring greater detection range.

full_text: Richardson RFPD, Inc. announced the availability and full design support capabilities for two new power amplifiers from MACOM Technology Solutions Inc.

full_text: AtlanTecRF has launched a lightweight, rugged and compact Drone Payload Satellite Simulator. It provides a transmit (Tx) to receive (Rx) loop-back in testing mostly compact and mobile satellite communications systems in situ and without the need for connection via cables.

title: Analog Devices Expands GaN Power Amplifier Portfolio with Two Broadband 6 GHz Modules
full_text: Analog Devices, Inc. announced a pair of high-performance GaN power amplifier (PA) modules which offer one of the highest power-density levels in their class, thus minimizing size and weight of the subsystem. The HMC7885 and HMC7748 broadband modules target applications operating between 2 GHz and 6 GHz, including test and measurement, communications, Traveling Wave Tube (TWT) replacement, military/aerospace surveillance and countermeasures and radar.

title: Mercury Systems Acquires Delta Microwave
full_text: Mercury Systems, Inc. announced that it has acquired Delta Microwave, LLC for $40.5 million in cash. Mercury was attracted by Delta's strengths in high power, high frequency active and passive microwave components and subassemblies — particularly in GaN solid-state power amplifiers — which are driving strong backlog and growth.

title: Bliley Introduces Iris: LEO Satellite OCXO
full_text: Bliley Technologies announced their low earth orbit (LEO) satellite OCXO product line, Iris. The Iris series OCXO was specifically designed for LEO orbit space applications, designed to be radiation tolerant for both total ionizing dosage and linear energy transfer typical of LEO orbits.

title: Gowanda is First in Industry to Offer ER SMT Inductors for Military RF Applications
full_text: Gowanda Electronics announced the introduction of the industry’s first off-the-shelf RF Surface Mount (SMT) Inductors with Established Reliability (ER) rating. The first-ever ER SMT series–Gowanda ER3013–was developed by Gowanda in response to a market need for surface mount options to the traditional leaded (thru-hole) designs.

title: Teledyne Completes Acquisition of e2v
full_text: Teledyne Technologies Inc. and e2v technologies plc jointly announced the successful completion of the previously announced acquisition by Teledyne of e2v by means of a Scheme of Arrangement.

title: HENSOLDT and Leonardo Offer Secure Mode-5 IFF systems
full_text: HENSOLDT and Leonardo have signed an agreement to offer Mode-5 Identification Friend or Foe solutions satisfy diverse customer’s needs around the world on a case-by-case basis.

title: Fairview Microwave Releases 8-Bit Programmable Phase Shifters with 360 Degrees Variable Phase Shift
full_text: Fairview Microwave Inc. has introduced a new series of 8-bit programmable phase shifters that are adjustable over a full 360° range. These three new models can produce a discrete set of phase states of up to 256 total steps in 1.4° increments with superior accuracy and minimal phase shift error.

title: Mercury Systems Awarded Follow-On Contract for DRFM Jammers
full_text: Mercury Systems, Inc. received a follow-on order from the U.S. Navy, valued at up to $153 million over five years, to deliver digital RF memory subsystems for jamming in a multi-threat environment.

title: SATELLITE 2017 Reflects Healthy, Optimistic Industry
full_text: The SATELLITE 2017 conference, held March 6-9 in Washington, reflected the optimism of an industry chasing the promises of broadband and the IoT, fueled by the investments of wealthy entrepreneurs. To wit, Jeff Bezos, who became rich on the success of Amazon, is parlaying that success into his reusable rocket venture Blue Origin and a vision of renewed space exploration. Microwave Journal attended SATELLITE 2017 to see what role the RF/microwave industry is playing.

title: SAGE Millimeter Releases V-Band, Dual Polarized Antenna Horn Assembly
full_text: SAGE Millimeter has released a V-Band, dual polarized horn antenna assembly covering 50 to 75 GHz. The antenna features an integrated orthomode transducer (OMT) that provides high port isolation and cross-polarization cancellation, enabling the antenna to separate a circular or elliptical polarized waveform into two linear, orthogonal waveforms. At the center frequency, the horn antenna has 15 dBi nominal gain and a typical half-power beamwidth of 28 degrees on the E-plane and 33 degrees on the H-plane.

title: Beijing’s New Airport to Operate Terma Surface Movement Radar
full_text: Terma has been awarded the delivery of SCANTER 5502 Surface Movement Radars to the new airport in Beijing, China opening in 2019.

title: New Tech Brief: How Phase Noise Affects Radar and Communications Systems
full_text: Custom MMIC has published a free technical brief, “Addressing Your Phase Noise Challenges in Radar and Communication Systems,” illuminating key aspects of how phase noise impacts signal quality in radar and communication systems. The tech brief provides insight into product solutions that can be used in radar and communication systems that are phase noise constrained.

title: New Radar Applications Driven by Technology
full_text: The increased focus on smaller platforms, more autonomous systems as well as a drive to faster time to deployment is creating a new paradigm in the defense industry.  The established ecosystems and traditional product development roles and responsibilities are unlikely to enable the most effective future solutions.

title: Radar Technology Advancements and New Applications
full_text: Kymeta has unveiled the commercialized version of the company’s Ku-Band electronically scanned antenna based on metamaterials technology. The mTenna, used with Kymeta’s KyWay terminal, provides a satellite link for mobile platforms or stationary sites that lack terrestrial infrastructure. The company also announced a partnership with Intelsat for a satellite data service using mTenna and KyWay.

title: Opportunities for Semiconductor Companies in the Changing Landscape of Global Defense
full_text: RFHIC Corp. of Anyang, South Korea, inked a deal with Element Six (E6), a member of the De Beers Group of companies, to acquire its GaN on diamond technology.

title: Kymeta Announces Commercial Release of Ku-Band Metamaterial Antenna and Satellite Data Service
full_text: Imec announced that 200 mm GaN on Si e-mode power devices showed no degradation after heavy ion and neutron irradiation, testing performed in collaboration with Thales Alenia Space. Imec's e-mode devices have a pGaN gate architecture.

title: RFHIC Signs Deal to Acquire Element Six’s GaN on Diamond Epiwafer Technology
full_text: Custom MMIC highlights the company's space qualification capabilities for high performance GaAs MMICs. Over 70 commercial off-the-shelf MMIC die can be qualified to MIL-PRF-38534 Class K or hermetic packaged and qualified per MIL-PRF-38535 Class S.

title: Imec’s 200 mm GaN-on-Si e-mode Power Devices Demonstrate Radiation Hardness
full_text: N/A

title: Custom MMIC in Orbit: Space Qualified GaAs MMICs
full_text: N/A

title: Empower RF Announces Market Release of Scalable Pulsed L-Band Power Amplifier
full_text: Empower RF released a scalable pulsed L-Band power amplifier with an expandable system hardware architecture designed to save money — "Buy only the power needed today" and add power amplifier blocks later when more output power is required.

title: Dow-Key® Microwave to Feature New Miniature Mechanical Switches at Satellite 2017 in Washington, D.C.
full_text: Dow-Key® Microwave will feature new miniature mechanical switches at Satellite 2017, Booth 315, in Washington, D.C., on March 6-9 at the Walter E. Washington Convention Center.

title: Eutelsat and ViaSat Create European Broadband Joint Venture
full_text: Eutelsat Communications and ViaSat Inc. have completed setting up a joint venture to expand Eutelsat's current wholesale broadband business and launch a new consumer retail service in Europe and the Mediterranean.

title: Qorvo Introduces Spatium Broadband Power Amplifiers for EW
full_text: N/A

title: MALD-J Upgrade Improves Navigation in a Jamming Environment
full_text: The GAINS II upgraded navigation system for the Miniature Air Launched Decoy-Jammer (MALD-J) was recently validated in six flight tests. The upgrade includes an enhanced multi-element antenna assembly to improve navigation when the GPS is being jammed.

title: Southwest Microwave Showcases High-Rel Interconnect Solutions at Satellite 2017
full_text: Southwest Microwave, a leading provider of hi-rel coax connectors and adapters for satellite applications, will feature their high-performance Super SMA, 2.92 mm (K), 2.40 mm (Q), 1.85 mm (V), and 1.0 mm (W) interconnect solutions at Satellite 2017.

title: MilSatCom USA Returns Stateside to Focus on Optimizing Future US MilSatCom Capabilities
full_text: SMi Group, organizers of leading industry event Global MilSatCom, announces the return of MilSatCom USA on June 28-29, 2017 at the Sheraton Pentagon City, Arlington, Va. As the space domain continues to grow even more congested, contested, and competitive, the need to ensure effective resiliency and protection on future MilSatCom systems is more crucial than ever before. Thus, the 2nd MilSatCom USA conference returns to provide a high-level forum for the US SatCom community to discuss how further comprehensive collaboration can be beneficial to all parties and stakeholders.

title: Saab Offering GaN-Based AESA Radar and EW Systems for Indian Tejas LCA Fighter
full_text: Saab is offering a sensor package for the Indian Tejas LCA Mk1A fighter aircraft that includes GaN-based AESAs for the radar and EW jammer. Saab says no ITAR-controlled components are used.

title: Thales to Supply GaN-Based CWI Transmitters to Royal Danish Navy
full_text: Thales will deliver 14, GaN-based, CWI transmitters that will be integrated into the Evolved Sea Sparrow Missile (ESSM) fire control systems on-board Royal Danish Navy vessels.

title: Quintech Electronics’ NEXUS-3 Mesh Test Matrix Selected by Leading Defense Contractor
full_text: Quintech Electronics & Communications Inc., a world leader in the design and manufacture of RF wireless test and measurement matrix switches, announced that its new NEXUS-3 Mesh Matrix product has been purchased by a leading defense contractor to enhance its RF Wireless Testing in support of U.S. Government activities.

title: Cree Terminating Wolfspeed Sale to Infineon
full_text: Unable to address the U.S. government's national security concerns, Cree will retain Wolfspeed and terminate the agreement to sell the power and RF business to Infineon Technologies.  Cree's CEO said the company will invest in Wolfspeed to grow the business.

title: Scale, Integrate, Incorporate and Disrupt in Defense
full_text: While the defense industry has been unable to sustain revenue growth, profitability has been growing. Sustaining an upwards trajectory for profit margins will require scale, the ability to integrate and incorporate new capabilities and the capacity to disrupt the competitive landscape through emerging technologies and by attacking adjacent markets.

title: IDT Acquiring GigPeak For ~$250M
full_text: Integrated Device Technology will acquire GigPeak for $3.08 per share or approximately $250 million in cash. The purchase price is approximately 22 percent higher than the closing price of GigPeak shares on February 10. The deal is expected to close during the second calendar quarter of 2017.

title: Gowanda Expands Capabilities with the Acquisition of Microwave Circuits
full_text: Gowanda Components Group is pleased to announce that its capabilities for the design and manufacture of RF and microwave filters are expanding in connection with the acquisition of Microwave Circuits from AMTI in Lynchburg, Va.

title: Mercury Systems Receives $4.1M Order for High-Resolution Imaging Application
full_text: Mercury Systems Inc. announced it received a $4.1 million follow-on order from a leading defense prime contractor for wideband millimeter wave transceivers for a homeland security high-resolution imaging application. The order was booked in the company's fiscal 2017 third quarter and is expected to be shipped over the next several quarters.

title: US Government Objects to Infineon Acquiring Wolfspeed
full_text: The Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) concluded that the proposed acquisition of Wolfspeed by Infineon "poses a risk to the national security of the United States." Infineon stated in a press release "that there is a considerable risk that the transaction, as agreed, is not going to close."

title: AtlanTecRF Appoints New North American Sales Manager
full_text: AtlanTecRF, a leading global RF and microwave components and equipment manufacturer, announced the appointment of Mike Andrioff as its new North American sales manager. Andrioff will be responsible for expanding AtlanTecRF’s North American business with a specific focus on growing the company’s already successful Satcom RF Testing Equipment sales.

title: AtlanTecRF Introduces Noise Injection Loop Test Translator
full_text: AtlanTecRF launched its LNI series of noise injection loop test translator (LTT) systems for off-satellite loop back testing of the transmit signal.

title: CEL Introduces High Performance and Low Cost pHEMTs for Ku- and Ka-Band Applications
full_text: CEL introduced low cost pHEMTs for Ku- and Ka-Band satellite receivers. These CEL pHEMTs are drop-in replacements to the Renesas pHEMTs, also offered by CEL.

title: Saab Expands Partnership with Akaer in Brazil
full_text: Saab has acquired another 10 per cent of shares, reaching 25 per cent of stakes, in Akaer, one of the largest companies within development of aeronautical projects in Brazil.

title: Small Satellite Regulatory Cooperation Strengthened in the Americas
full_text: The International Telecommunication Union’s SmallSat Symposium and Workshop has strengthened cooperation and partnerships in the Americas region.

title: Brazilian SGDC Dual-use Communication Satellite Shipped for Launch
full_text: The dual use SGDC Geostationary Defense and Strategic Communications Satellite built by Thales Alenia Space for Brazil is ready to be shipped to Kourou, French Guyana for launch in March.

title: Hispasat 36W-1 Satellite Carries Ground-Breaking Airbus Technology
full_text: When launched on 27 January 2017 Hispasat 36W-1 (AG-1) became the first satellite to use active Ku-Band antennas, which were supplied by Airbus Defence and Space.

title: Astronics Test Systems Announces New PXIe Test Instruments
full_text: Astronics Corp., through its wholly-owned subsidiary Astronics Test Systems, introduced two new test instruments. The new PXIe-1802 Arbitrary Waveform Generator and the new PXIe-1803 Digitizer deliver unprecedented test capabilities and measurement accuracy in a compact, robust PXI form factor for aerospace, defense, communications, and other high-reliability applications.

title: Thales to Upgrade the Swiss AF Master Radars
full_text: As part of the FLORAKO programme modernisation, armasuisse has awarded Thales a contract to upgrade the Master radars for the Swiss Air Force. This contract, which amounts to 74 million euros, will be the main order within the broader FLORAKO radars life extension project approved by the Swiss government in 2016, is intended to extend the lifespan of the radars and to ensure operational excellence until 2030.

title: U.S. Navy Awards Raytheon Co. $235M For Standard Missile-6 Production
full_text: The U.S. Navy awarded Raytheon Co. $235 million for Standard Missile-6 all-up round production missiles and spares. Raytheon will begin delivery in 2018. The missiles will be deployed on Aegis cruisers and destroyers to support U.S. Navy fleet operations. The award funds the fourth year of full-rate production for the multi-mission missile, which recently accomplished significant testing milestones and achievements.

title: Phasor and Thales Alenia Space Team Up for Development of Advanced Broadband Smart Terminal
full_text: Phasor and Thales Alenia Space (TAS) have signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) for the development of a software-defined, smart terminal for commercial Ka satellite communications.

title: Phonon Corp. Receives $7.2M Order for SAW Radar Pulse Compression Modules
full_text: Phonon Corp. has received an $7.2M order from a leading defense prime contractor for Surface Acoustic Wave (SAW) radar pulse compression modules, for 2017 and 2018 delivery, for an air defense system.

title: Saab Invests to Grow New York-Based Business
full_text: Saab has signed an agreement with New York State to develop its business in the United States and local presence in NYS.

title: AUDS Counter-drone System First to Achieve TRL-9 Status Following Successful Deployment
full_text: The AUDS counter-UAS defence system – field proven to detect, track and defeat malicious and errant unmanned aircraft systems (UAS) or drones – is the first fully integrated system worldwide to achieve TRL-9 status. This follows the successful mission deployment of the AUDS system with United States Forces.

title: Mercury Receives $2.4M Order for EW Application
full_text: Mercury Systems Inc. announced it received a $2.4 million follow-on order from a leading defense prime contractor to supply frequency conversion modules for an Electronic Warfare (EW) service life extension program. The order was booked in the company’s fiscal 2017 second quarter and is expected to be shipped over the next several quarters.

title: Qorvo Receives Trusted Source Accreditation from DoD
full_text: Qorvo® has earned continued Trusted Source Category 1A accreditation through 2018 from the U.S. Department of Defense (DoD). The company is one of only five accredited suppliers for both gallium nitride (GaN) and gallium arsenide (GaAs).

title: Leonardo Begins Operating as Leonardo MW Ltd. in UK
full_text: Leonardo strengthens its position in the UK as it begins operating as one new single entity, Leonardo MW Ltd.

title: Digital Beamforming Accelerates the Evolution to Next-Generation Radar
full_text: Airbus Defence and Space has agreed to sell its share in Atlas Elektronik Group to thyssenkrupp AG, which will make the company the sole owner.

title: Tile Arrays Accelerate the Evolution to Next-Generation Radar
full_text: Thales’ latest-generation Spy’Ranger mini surveillance and reconnaissance Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) has been chosen by the French Defence Procurement Agency (DGA) to equip the French forces. Up to 70 mini-UAV reconnaissance systems (SMDR) will be made available from 2018. Each system consists of three mini-UAVs, a ground segment and the associated technical support.

title: Airbus Sells Shares in Atlas Elektronik
full_text: Harris Corp. has been awarded a $91 million IDIQ contract by Warner Robins Air Logistics Center to provide AN/ALQ-211 Advanced Integrated Defensive Electronic Warfare Suite (AIDEWS) systems to the Royal Moroccan Air Force (RMAF). The contract was awarded during the second quarter of Harris' fiscal 2017.

title: Thales to Equip French Forces With Spy'Ranger Mini Reconnaissance UAVs
full_text: Mercury Systems Inc. received a $24.4 million follow-on order from a leading defense prime for integrated RF and digital subsystems for an EW system. The order, which includes an option to purchase additional units, is planned to be shipped over the next several quarters.

title: Harris to Supply EW Systems to RMAF
full_text: The emergence of electronic and network centric warfare, replacement of legacy systems resulting in the automaton of radar systems, territorial conflicts and geopolitical instabilities, and sea-based X-Band radars, among others, are driving the demand for the X-Band radar across the globe.

title: Mercury Receives Integrated RF and Digital Subsystems Order for EW Application
full_text: N/A

title: X-Band Radar Market Worth $5.61B by 2021
full_text: N/A

title: QinetiQ Acquires Meggitt Target Systems
full_text: QinetiQ has acquired Meggitt Defence Systems Ltd. and Meggitt Holdings Canada Inc. from Meggitt for £57.5 million.

title: Saab Signs Support Agreement With UAE
full_text: Saab has signed a support agreement with the United Arab Emirates regarding an airborne surveillance system.

title: 2,036 Apprentices in Training at BAE Systems
full_text: BAE Systems announced that it is currently training an unprecedented 2,036 apprentices across its UK-based defence and security businesses.

title: Leonardo-finmeccanica Acquires Sistemi Dinamici
full_text: Leonardo-Finmeccanica acquired the full control of Sistemi Dinamici S.p.A from IDS S.p.A on December 23, 2016. The control of the company, which involved the remaining 60 percent of shares, is aimed at further strengthening the commitment of Leonardo in unmanned products thanks to the acquisition of the new unmanned lightweight helicopter SD-150 Hero programme.

title: Lockheed Martin Receives $1.45B Contract for PAC-3 Missiles
full_text: The United States and allied military forces will upgrade their missile defense capabilities under a new $1.45 billion contract for production and delivery of Lockheed Martin Patriot Advanced Capability-3 (PAC-3) and PAC-3 Missile Segment Enhancement (PAC-3 MSE) interceptors.

title: Mercury Systems Receives $10.8M Order from US Navy for DRFM Jammers
full_text: Mercury Systems Inc., announced that it received a $10.8 million follow-on order against its 5 year sole source basic ordering agreement (BOA) to deliver advanced Digital RF Memory (DRFM) jammers to the U.S. Navy. The order was received in the Company's fiscal 2017 second quarter and is expected to be shipped over the next several quarters.

title: Raytheon to Demo New Tech for Uninterrupted Military Communications in Contested Environments
full_text: The U.S. Air Force has awarded Raytheon Co. a $37 million contract to demonstrate new satellite communications technology that will continuously link tactical users with military leaders in contested environments.

title: MBT Acquires MACOM's Metelics Londonderry Point Contact Diode Product Line
full_text: Effective October 28, 2016, MACOM sold the former Metelics Londonderry Point Contact Diode product line to Massachusetts Bay Technologies (MBT), located at 378 Page Street, Stoughton, Mass. This product line will be moved to MBT at the end of December 2016 and fully functional by the first week of January 2017.

title: OneWeb Raises $1.2 Billion to Fund Satellite Production
full_text: OneWeb Ltd., founded in 2012 with the goal of providing affordable internet access for everyone on the planet using a constellation of 720 low earth orbit (LEO) satellites, announced it has secured $1.2 billion to fund satellite development and the construction of a high volume satellite production facility in Exploration Park, Fla.

title: ViaSat and Boeing Complete Preliminary Design Review for ViaSat-3 Satellites
full_text: ViaSat Inc. and Boeing completed the preliminary design review (PDR) for the first two geostationary ViaSat-3 satellites, being designed to deliver more than 1 Tbps network capacity.

title: Worcester Polytechnic Institute Professor Receives ORB Analytics Award
full_text: Worcester Polytechnic Institute (WPI) electrical and computer engineering professor Alex Wyglinski has received an ORB Analytics award for his work, “A High-Speed Variable Rate PSK Satellite Modem.”

title: Cobham Introduces Ultra-Wideband Gooseneck Antennas
full_text: Cobham Antenna Systems has introduced two ultra-wideband gooseneck antennas.

title: Pasternack Launches Waveguide Direct Read Attenuators Covering 18 to 110 GHz
full_text: Pasternack, a leading provider of RF, microwave and millimeter wave products, has released a new line of waveguide direct read attenuators for instrumentation, test benches, high efficiency RF/Microwave transmissions, SATCOM, MILCOM, radar and telecom applications.

title: Anaren Selected to Receive Orders in Excess of $40M
full_text: Anaren Inc. announced that its subsidiary Unicircuit will receive orders over $40 million from Lockheed Martin for microwave assemblies in support of the Long Range Discrimination Radar (LRDR) system. LRDR will support a layered ballistic missile defense strategy to protect the U.S. homeland from ballistic missile attacks.

title: 6.5 to 40 GHz Microwave Power Modules
full_text: Tektronix Inc., a leading worldwide provider of test, measurement and monitoring instrumentation,  announced the RSA7100A wideband signal analysis solution that combines 800 MHz of real-time bandwidth with up to 2 hours of streaming storage at full bandwidth in one solution. The new instrument’s 16 kHz to 26.5 GHz frequency range covers a broad range of analysis needs for critical wide-bandwidth applications.

title: Tektronix Introduces RSA7100A Wideband Signal Analysis Solution
full_text: Saab has completed a successful two-day seminar in Brussels, Belgium to explore potential co-operation and partnerships with Belgian companies active in the aeronautics sector.

title: Saab Explores Potential Partnerships with Belgian Industry
full_text: Teledyne Technologies Inc. and e2v technologies plc jointly announced that they have reached agreement on the terms of a recommended cash acquisition to be made by Teledyne for the ordinary share capital of e2v by means of a Scheme of Arrangement. It is expected that the acquisition will be completed in the first half of calendar 2017.

title: Teledyne to Acquire e2v
full_text: Blighter Surveillance Systems has unveiled the Blighter® C400 series coastal security radar that features advanced Doppler signal processing, low power PESA and FMCW technologies for coastal security detection.

title: Blighter’s Coastal Security Radar Optimized to Detect the Undetectable
full_text: xG Technology Inc. (xG) business unit Integrated Microwave Technologies (IMT), a leader in advanced digital microwave systems serving the law enforcement, broadcast, sports and entertainment markets, announced it has received a $450,000 order from a state investigation bureau located in the South Atlantic region (“ the Bureau”) for the IMT Airborne Video Downlink System (AVDS).

title: IMT Receives $450,000 Order for Airborne Video Downlink System
full_text: N/A

title: Microsemi Unveils Six New Wideband, High Performance MMIC Products
full_text: Microsemi Corp. announced six new monolithic microwave integrated circuit (MMIC) products, including four wideband low noise MMIC amplifiers (MMA040AA, MMA041AA, MMA043AA and MMA044AA) and two wideband GaAs MMIC switches (MMS006AA and MMS008AA). The new MMIC products are ideally suited for test and measurement, electronic warfare and radar applications.

title: BAE Systems Opens Aerospace Skills and Training Academy in UK
full_text: BAE Systems has opened the £15.6 million Academy for Skills & Knowledge training academy, marking the single largest investment in skills for the UK’s aerospace sector.

title: Cree and Infineon Targeting February for Close of Wolfspeed Acquisition
full_text: In a filing with the SEC, Cree stated that Infineon’s acquisition of Cree’s Wolfspeed subsidiary is proceeding through the regulatory review process, including the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States. Cree and Infineon believe the transaction will close in February 2017.

title: Pentek Introduces Rugged and Lightweight  Portable Talon RF/IF Signal Recorder
full_text: Pentek Inc. announced a new member of its popular family of Talon® RF/IF signal recording and playback systems. The Model RTR 2727A rugged portable recorder targets applications needing to record and reproduce high-bandwidth signals. A complete PC workstation, the RTR 2727A provides high data capacity and aggregate recording rates of up to 4.0 GB/s in a four-channel system.

title: Cobham, Harris Corp. Build New Test and Alignment Software
full_text: Cobham is working with Harris Corp. to provide automated test and alignment capabilities for Harris XL-200P P25 radios using the Cobham 3920B Digital Radio Test Set. The Harris XL-200P is a multiband portable radio that supports P25 communications on VHF, UHF, and 700/800 MHz spectrum.

title: Lockheed Martin Awarded $1.2B to Modernize Republic of Korea F-16s
full_text: Lockheed Martin was awarded a $1.2 billion contract to upgrade 134 F-16 aircraft for the Republic of Korea Air Force (ROKAF). Among the enhancements are an Active Electronically Scanned Array (AESA) radar, a modern commercial off-the-shelf (COTS)-based avionics subsystem, a large-format, high-resolution center pedestal display and a high-volume and high-speed data bus.

title: CPI Awarded Contract To Support New Generation Of Meteorological Satellites
full_text: The Communications & Medical Products Division of Communications & Power Industries (CPI) has been awarded an €8.7 million, or approximately $9.5 million, contract by Airbus Defence and Space to support a new generation of satellites that is expected to provide global advanced meteorological data from 2021 until after 2040.

title: Pasternack Delivers High Power Amplification with GaN Technology
full_text: Pasternack, a leading provider of RF, microwave and millimeter wave products, offers a number of high power broadband amplifiers that can be used across a wide range of applications including electronic warfare, radar, communications, and test and measurement.

title: EU Approves Budget Increase for European Defence Agency
full_text: The European Defence Agency received its first budget increase after a six-year freeze when officials from London declined to veto the raise. The move boosts the agency's annual budget from $32.7 million in 2016 to $33.1 million in 2017. All European Union countries except Denmark are affected by the decision, IHS Janes reports.

title: Ducommun Receives Contract from Airbus for Satellite Communications Components
full_text: Ducommun Inc. announced that it has received a contract from Airbus Defence and Space to design and manufacture high reliability (Hi-Rel) switch matrices used in space. Ducommun will produce the switch matrices at its Carson, Calif., operations center through July 2018. A switch matrix is a system of electronic components that route RF signals between multiple inputs and outputs. Airbus will use the Hi-Rel switch matrices on satellites that provide mobile communications for both military and commercial customers in remote areas.
